Trump demands $1 billion from UCLA over antisemitism claims: Here's why California says it's political
US President Donald Trump's administration is demanding a $1 billion settlement from UCLA over alleged civil rights violations tied to antisemitism. The DOJ claims UCLA failed to protect Jewish students during 2024 protests. California officials, including Governor Gavin Newsom, called the demand politically motivated. The case follows similar settlements with Columbia and Brown universities. UCLA has already settled a related lawsuit for $6 million and introduced new measures to address antisemitism and campus safety.
Trump demands $1 billion from UCLA over antisemitism claims: Here's why California says it's political - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsTrump demands $1 billion from UCLA over antisemitism claims: Here's why California says it's politicalTrendingUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentTrump demands $1 billion from UCLA over antisemitism claims: Here's why California says it's politicalSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 10, 2025, 20:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeUS President Donald Trump's administration is demanding a $1 billion settlement from UCLA over alleged civil rights violations tied to antisemitism. The DOJ claims UCLA failed to protect Jewish students during 2024 protests. California officials, including Governor Gavin Newsom, called the demand politically motivated. The case follows similar settlements with Columbia and Brown universities. UCLA has already settled a related lawsuit for $6 million and introduced new measures to address antisemitism and campus safety. cseeks $1 billion from UCLA over antisemitism claims as California pushes back The administration of US President Donald Trump is seeking a $1 billion settlement from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), following accusations from the Department of Justice (DOJ) that the university violated federal civil rights laws by failing to address antisemitic incidents on campus. A White House official, speaking on condition of anonymity, confirmed the demand, as reported by the Associated Press.UCLA is the first public university to face such a large-scale financial penalty amid the Trump administration's broader push to reform higher education institutions it claims are failing to uphold civil rights protections. Federal funding for UCLA was suspended earlier, totalling $584 million, according to university officials.DOJ cites violation of civil rights law and the Fourteenth AmendmentAccording to a DOJ finding issued on July 29, UCLA violated Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and the equal protection clause of the Fourteenth Amendment by “acting with deliberate indifference in creating a hostile educational environment for Jewish and Israeli students,” as reported by the Associated Press.The allegations stem largely from the university's handling of protests related to the 2024 Israel-Hamas war. During one night of unrest, counterprotesters attacked a pro-Palestinian encampment on UCLA's campus, resulting in several injuries before police intervened hours later. Over 200 individuals were arrested the following day after refusing orders to disband. Jewish students reported being blocked from campus areas and classrooms by demonstrators.California officials respond to $1 billion demandCalifornia Governor Gavin Newsom accused the Trump administration of using financial threats for political purposes. Speaking to reporters, he said, “He has threatened us through extortion with a billion-dollar fine unless we do his bidding,” as quoted by the Associated Press. He contrasted California's response with settlements reached by private institutions, stating, “We will not be like some of those other institutions that have followed a different path.”James B. Milliken, president of the University of California, said the university had “just received” the DOJ document and would review it. He noted that such a settlement “would completely devastate our country's greatest public university system,” as reported by the Associated Press. Milliken, who recently assumed office, stated the university had offered to engage in a “good faith dialogue” with the DOJ.Settlements with other universities set precedentThe Trump administration has already reached civil rights settlements with other institutions, including $50 million from Brown University and $221 million from Columbia University. Columbia also regained access to over $400 million in research grants. Negotiations with Harvard University are ongoing, with the administration reportedly pressing for a larger settlement.UCLA previously settled separate civil rights lawsuitLast week, UCLA reached a $6 million settlement in a civil rights lawsuit filed by three Jewish students and a Jewish professor. The university also committed $2.3 million to organisations addressing antisemitism and supporting its Jewish community. As part of broader reforms, UCLA established an Office of Campus and Community Safety and introduced new systemwide protest guidelines.As reported by the Associated Press, Chancellor Julio Frenk, whose family history includes Holocaust survivors, also launched an initiative aimed at combating antisemitism and anti-Israeli bias on campus.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!About the AuthorSanjay SharmaSanjay Sharma is a seasoned journalist with over two decades of experience in the media industry. Currently serving as Assistant Editor - Education at TimesofIndia.com, he specializes in education-related content, including board results, job notifications, and studying abroad. Since joining TOI in 2006, he has played a pivotal role in expanding the platform’s digital presence and spearheading major education events. Previously, Sanjay held leadership positions in sports journalism, covering high-profile events such as the Cricket World Cup and Olympics. He holds a PG Diploma in Journalism from Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan and is proficient in various content management systems.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous8 times Mrunal Thakur set the ramp on fireLifestyle10 things to know before getting a Pomeranian as pet dogLifestyleBigg Boss Malayalam 7: Contestants' stunning outfits for the weekendtv10 books to boost emotional intelligence and inner strengthLifestyle8 animals that “play dead” better than actorsLifestyleAnushka Shetty's saree looks you'll must tryEntertainment6 natural pest control solutions for a healthy balcony gardenLifestyle10 creatures with invisible skinLifestyle8 beauty mistakes to avoid if you want to defy ageingLifestyleTejasswi Prakash inspired top 10glamorous gowntv Next123 Photostories  Priyanka Chopra’s 8 bold and fierce film roles that prove she’s a global powerhouseBreast Cancer: 7 myths vs facts that can raise more awareness and save lives10 lesser known foods from Himachal PradeshInspiring Bollywood films that show dreams thrive against all odds with hope and resilienceThe difference between Labubu, Zimomo and MococoBox office bombs, musical masterpieces: 5 Bollywood flops with iconic soundtracksInside Meghan Markle and Prince Harry’s luxurious Montecito mansion5 supplements one should avoid to control high blood pressure5 surprising signs the body needs more protein and 3 easy recipes to fix itFrom ‘RRR’ to ‘Athadu’; Trump hands political appointees control over science funding: Here’s why researchers are sounding the alarm
President Trump's executive order gives political appointees control over federal science grants, requiring agencies like NIH and NSF to ensure funding aligns with political priorities. Grants can be terminated anytime, raising concerns among researchers about political interference in scientific funding. The order delays new funding announcements and threatens projects on health and public safety. Experts warn this could hinder US research leadership and may face legal challenges.
Trump hands political appointees control over science funding: Here’s why researchers are sounding the alarm - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsTrump hands political appointees control over science funding: Here’s why researchers are sounding the alarmTrendingUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentUS Higher Education SystemSundar PichaiDelhi School Fee Regulation BillElon MuskSSC Phase XII ExamKarnataka PGCET ResultIndian Navy RecruitmentNIACL AO RecruitmentWBCAP UG Merit ListNEET UG Seat AllotmentTrump hands political appointees control over science funding: Here’s why researchers are sounding the alarmSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 10, 2025, 19:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePresident Trump's executive order gives political appointees control over federal science grants, requiring agencies like NIH and NSF to ensure funding aligns with political priorities. Grants can be terminated anytime, raising concerns among researchers about political interference in scientific funding. The order delays new funding announcements and threatens projects on health and public safety. Experts warn this could hinder US research leadership and may face legal challenges. Trump executive order gives political control over federal science funding. (AI Image) Trump hands political appointees control over science funding: Here's why researchers are sounding the alarmPresident Trump has signed an executive order that grants political appointees increased authority over the allocation of billions of dollars in federal grants across various US government agencies. The order requires agencies such as the National Science Foundation (NSF), the National Institutes of Health (NIH), and FEMA to designate officials responsible for reviewing grant opportunities to ensure they align with agency priorities and the “national interest.”The new directives also allow agencies to terminate existing and future grants at any point during the grant period. This significant shift in the grant process has raised concerns among scientists who warn it could undermine the impartial funding system that has long supported US leadership in research and development.Changes in federal grant oversight and implications for researchUnder the order, no new federal funding opportunities can be announced until the agencies implement the new review protocols. The Trump administration states these measures are intended to “strengthen oversight” and “streamline agency grantmaking.” However, researchers argue the changes introduce political interference into what was previously a merit-based funding process.Joseph Bak-Coleman, a scientist specialising in group decision-making at the University of Washington, said this is “taking political control of a once politically neutral mechanism for funding science in the US,” as quoted by the Associated Press. The move has raised fears that decisions about scientific grants may no longer be based solely on expertise and research merit.Impact on scientific progress and emergency fundingThe changes have already resulted in the termination of thousands of research grants, including projects on transgender health, vaccine hesitancy, misinformation, and diversity, equity, and inclusion, according to the Associated Press. The Association of American Medical Colleges warned that the order will “delay grant review and approval,” slowing progress in critical areas such as cures and treatments urgently needed by patients and families nationwide.Beyond scientific research, the executive order could affect emergency relief grants managed by FEMA, public safety funding through the Department of Justice, and public health programmes supported by the Centres for Disease Control (CDC). Experts suggest that the increased political control over grant distribution may influence the effectiveness of these essential services.Potential legal challenges and future consequencesThe executive order is expected to face legal challenges, as its sweeping changes raise questions about the proper role of political influence in federal grantmaking. The uncertainty caused by the new rules may disrupt ongoing projects and deter future research initiatives, experts say.In summary, the Trump administration's executive order introduces new layers of political oversight into the federal grant system, shifting power to political appointees and raising concerns among the scientific community about the future of unbiased, merit-based funding in the US.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Currently serving as Assistant Editor - Education at TimesofIndia.com, he specializes in education-related content, including board results, job notifications, and studying abroad. Since joining TOI in 2006, he has played a pivotal role in expanding the platform’s digital presence and spearheading major education events. Previously, Sanjay held leadership positions in sports journalism, covering high-profile events such as the Cricket World Cup and Olympics. He holds a PG Diploma in Journalism from Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan and is proficient in various content management systems.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousBigg Boss Malayalam 7: Contestants' stunning outfits for the weekendtv10 books to boost emotional intelligence and inner strengthLifestyle8 animals that “play dead” better than actorsLifestyleAnushka Shetty's saree looks you'll must tryEntertainment6 natural pest control solutions for a healthy balcony gardenLifestyle10 creatures with invisible skinLifestyle8 beauty mistakes to avoid if you want to defy ageingLifestyleTejasswi Prakash inspired top 10glamorous gowntvAnju Kurian charms with her elegant ethnic flairEntertainmentRakul Preet Singh's majestic fashion momentsEntertainment Next123 Photostories  10 lesser known foods from Himachal PradeshInspiring Bollywood films that show dreams thrive against all odds with hope and resilienceThe difference between Labubu, Zimomo and MococoBox office bombs, musical masterpieces: 5 Bollywood flops with iconic soundtracksInside Meghan Markle and Prince Harry’s luxurious Montecito mansion5 supplements one should avoid to control high blood pressure5 surprising signs the body needs more protein and 3 easy recipes to fix itFrom ‘RRR’ to ‘Athadu’; Grit turns bold as rough stories grow into big action films8 most unique hotels from across the worldVanished stars of Indian cinema: When fame faded into silence123Hot PicksGlobal Standard indexUS stocks todayIndia-US tariffIntel CEOMukesh AmbaniUS jobless dataRussia crude oilTop TrendingTyreek HillSelena GomezKim KardashianTaylor SwiftTravis KelcePaige SpiranacNBA Trade RumorsBrittney GrinerShannon SharpeSanju SamsonTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn EducationEntire WebsiteUniversity endowment tax hike is costing students, not just colleges: Here’s why it matters more than you thinkCan teachers opt out? How films transform cinema into a spiritual experience
Recent films like 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' 'Kantara,' and 'HanuMan' are transforming cinema into spiritual experiences, with audiences treating theaters as sacred spaces. Viewers are engaging in temple-like rituals, chanting mantras, removing shoes, and offering prayers during screenings. These movies tap into deep-rooted faith and cultural traditions, fostering a profound connection beyond mere entertainment, blurring the lines between cinema and worship.
When theaters turn sacred: How films like ‘Mahavatar Narsimha,’ ‘Kantara,’ ‘HanuMan,’ and ‘Adipurush’ transform cinema into a spiritual experience | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWhen theaters turn sacred: How films like ‘Mahavatar Narsimha,’ ‘Kantara,’ ‘HanuMan,’ and ‘Adipurush’ transform cinema into a spiritual experienceTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionWhen theaters turn sacred: How films like ‘Mahavatar Narsimha,’ ‘Kantara,’ ‘HanuMan,’ and ‘Adipurush’ transform cinema into a spiritual experienceTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 16:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRecent films like 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' 'Kantara,' and 'HanuMan' are transforming cinema into spiritual experiences, with audiences treating theaters as sacred spaces. Viewers are engaging in temple-like rituals, chanting mantras, removing shoes, and offering prayers during screenings. These movies tap into deep-rooted faith and cultural traditions, fostering a profound connection beyond mere entertainment, blurring the lines between cinema and worship.  When theaters turn sacred: How films like ‘Mahavatar Narsimha,’ ‘Kantara,’ ‘HanuMan,’ and ‘Adipurush’ transform cinema into a spiritual experienceCinema has always been a reflection of human emotion—it can make us laugh, cry, think, and even challenge our beliefs. But every once in a while, a film does something more. It transcends entertainment, evoking a spiritual connection so profound that theaters themselves feel transformed into temples.'Mahavatar Narsimha' Rockets to ₹37 Crore in Six Days—Animated Epic Becomes Surprise HitThe latest example is Mahavatar Narsimha, a mythological spectacle that is not only ruling the box office but also capturing the hearts and minds of audiences across India.A tradition rooted in the pastThis phenomenon isn’t new. In the 1970s, devotional films like Jai Santoshi Maa witnessed unprecedented audience devotion. People brought flowers, lit incense sticks, performed aartis inside cinema halls, and even distributed prasad. For many, the screenings were as sacred as temple visits.The same tradition has found a modern revival. With Mahavatar Narsimha and other films in this genre, audiences are once again blurring the lines between watching a film and participating in a religious ritual.The divine pull of ‘Mahavatar Narsimha’The film narrates the timeless tale of devotee Prahlad and his unwavering faith in Lord Vishnu. Prahlad’s father, the tyrant king Hiranyakashipu, deems Vishnu his enemy and makes repeated attempts to kill his own son. But as the legend goes, the Lord himself descends in the form of Narsimha—half man, half lion—to protect his devotee and destroy evil.Audiences have been left awestruck, not just by the film’s visual grandeur and animation but by the divine aura it creates. In many theaters, people are removing their shoes before entering, as if stepping into a temple. Others are chanting mantras and slokas during the climax, their voices echoing in the dark halls.The film’s makers recently shared a heartfelt note on social media, saying:“We are humbled and overwhelmed by the divine response to Mahavatar Narsimha. What began as a cinematic dream has now become a spiritual movement across the country. Theaters have turned into sacred spaces, with devotees performing kirtans, singing aartis, and experiencing a deep connection with Narsimha Dev. This film was never just a movie; it was a vision to rekindle faith and celebrate our rich spiritual heritage. Seeing people from all walks of life come together in devotion is the greatest reward we could have imagined.”They further added, “Your love proves that Bharat is ready and eager for stories rooted in our shastras and dharma. This is just the beginning—with your blessings, we will continue to bring such powerful stories to life.”The ‘Kantara’ phenomenonJust a couple of years ago, Rishab Shetty’s Kantara created a similar impact. Rooted in the folklore and traditions of coastal Karnataka, the film culminated in a spiritually charged climax that left audiences spellbound. There were even reports of people experiencing trance-like states and feeling “possessed” during the final sequences, a testament to the film’s deep cultural resonance.The film blurred the line between cinema and ritual, proving that when storytelling taps into collective memory and faith, the experience can go far beyond the screen.The power of ‘HanuMan’Prashanth Varma’s HanuMan took this divine connection to a new level, blending superhero spectacle with spiritual symbolism. Theaters reverberated with chants of “Jai Shri Ram” and “Jai Hanuman” as the film unfolded, with many viewers describing an “unmatchable energy” they felt while watching.In some places, the screening turned into a collective act of worship, with audience members offering prayers and sharing prasad, just as they would in a temple.Interesting the movie shows how faith is of utmost importance.In an interview with NDTV, Ashwin Kumar clarified that Mahavatar Narsimha is not aimed solely at Hindus, but is meant for people of all faiths. “I’ve had people from various communities, including many Muslim viewers, tell me that the film strengthened their own faith. I’m not asking anyone to convert their religion. What I’m saying is—understand what faith is. Whether you pray to a God, believe in energy, or place your trust in the universe, this film simply asks you to surrender to that faith,” he explained. Mahavatar Narsimha tells the story of the evil king Hirankashyap, blessed with special layered immunity by Lord Brahma. When he mistreats his son Prahlada, a devoted follower of Lord Vishnu, the deity takes the form of Lord Narsimha to protect the child.However, Kumar insists the film is not “religious” in the conventional sense. “This is not a religious film—it’s an interfaith film about belief. Love is a universal emotion, and so is faith. That’s why the film is growing in leaps and bounds,” he said.When the divine shows up in real lifeIn the case of Adipurush, the mythology seemed to spill into the real world when a monkey—considered sacred in Hindu tradition—unexpectedly appeared during filming. For many, it felt like a sign of divine blessing, adding to the film’s spiritual aura even before its release.Shiva Rajkumar Reactions After Watching HanuMan Movie | Teja Sajja | prasanth varmaWhen cinema becomes faithThese films show that cinema has the power to be more than just entertainment. It can be a spiritual awakening, a communal act of devotion, and a reminder of the cultural and religious threads that bind people together.In such moments, the theater ceases to be just a building with a screen—it becomes a sanctum, a place where stories are not only watched but also worshipped.And perhaps that is the true magic of cinema: its ability to move people so deeply that they forget they are watching fiction and instead feel they are in the presence of the divine.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSharvari Wagh brings charm to every pink detailEntertainment10 animals that can survive intense radiationLifestyleHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? Kapil Sharma takes dig at Udit Narayan's kiss controversy
Kapil Sharma's comedy show will feature musicians Vishal Dadlani, Shekhar Ravijani, Shaan, and Neeti Mohan. In a promo, Kapil playfully teased Udit Narayan about his kissing controversy, referencing a viral video where the latter kissed a fan during a concert. The comedian's remarks sparked laughter and some criticism online. Read on to know more.
Kapil Sharma's funny dig at Udit Narayan's kissing concert controversy will leave you in splits; says THIS | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodKapil Sharma's funny dig at Udit Narayan's kissing concert controversy will leave you in splits; says THISTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKapil Sharma's funny dig at Udit Narayan's kissing concert controversy will leave you in splits; says THISTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 17:05 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKapil Sharma's comedy show will feature musicians Vishal Dadlani, Shekhar Ravijani, Shaan, and Neeti Mohan. In a promo, Kapil playfully teased Udit Narayan about his kissing controversy, referencing a viral video where the latter kissed a fan during a concert. The comedian's remarks sparked laughter and some criticism online. Read on to know more.  Bollywood actor-comedian Kapil Sharma will be hosting several musicians in the upcoming episode of his comedy show on OTT. The special guests are Vishal Dadlani, Shekhar Ravijani, Shaan, and Neeti Mohan. During his candid, fun-filled comments, Kapil took a playful dig at veteran singer Udit Narayan over his kissing controversy.Kapil Sharma on Udit Narayan's kiss controversyAhead of the episode's release, the makers dropped the promo of the same on its social media handle. A part of the promo has gone viral, as it featured Kapil commenting on Udit Narayan. Kapil Sharma's life under Threat| Comedian gets chilling warning after second cafe shooting.In the video, one can watch the 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon' actor saying, "Shaan bhai aur Udit sir, dono haste haste gaate hain, dono se milney fan stage par aatey hain. Yeh baat alag hai ki Shaan bhai jaadu ki jhappi detey hain aur Udit ji toh jaadu hi kar detey hain." The clip also featured Kapil pulling Navjot Singh Sidhu's leg. Fans couldn't stop themselves from dropping laughing emojis in the comment section. Some even expressed that the comedian-host should sometimes "hesitate."Udit Narayan’s kiss controversyA video of Udit Narayan's live concert surfaced on the internet in February this year. In the clip, he was seen kissing a female fan on the lips when she was going to give him a peck on his cheeks after clicking a selfie. The video received massive backlash, and people questioned the behaviour of a singer like Udit Narayan. Later, videos of him giving kisses to other female singers like Alka Yagnik and Shreya Ghoshal also went viral.Later, in a statement, Udit Narayan clarified that the video was from a concert in Australia which happened two years ago. Also, dismissing the flak, he called his behaviour gestures born out of fans' "deewangi."Meanwhile, this is the third season of Kapil Sharma's comedy show. It started airing on June 21, 2025.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous8 vertical gardening ideas for tiny balconiesLifestyleEnid Blyton’s birthday: Timeless quotes of the beloved children’s author to live byLifestyle10 quotes on marriages by Swami Premanand Ji MaharajLifestyleSharvari Wagh brings charm to every pink detailEntertainment10 animals that can survive intense radiationLifestyleHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? Ashish on India's Got Latent row: 'Ranveer kuch bhi bol deta hai...'
Ashish Chanchalani recently recounted the aftermath of the 'India's Got Latent' controversy, revealing he was the first panelist approached by police. He explained Samay Raina was in Vancouver, Apoorva Mukhija was unreachable, and Ranveer Allahbadia had disappeared. Ashish expressed frustration at the seriousness of the situation, clarifying that even his laughter was scrutinized and had to be explained to authorities.
Ashish Chanchalani says police approached him first after India's Got Latent row as Samay Raina, Apoorva Mukhija were unreachable: 'Ranveer Allahbadia kuch bhi bol deta hai...' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAshish Chanchalani says police approached him first after India's Got Latent row as Samay Raina, Apoorva Mukhija were unreachable: 'Ranveer Allahbadia kuch bhi bol deta hai...'TrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionAshish Chanchalani says police approached him first after India's Got Latent row as Samay Raina, Apoorva Mukhija were unreachable: 'Ranveer Allahbadia kuch bhi bol deta hai...'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:47 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAshish Chanchalani recently recounted the aftermath of the 'India's Got Latent' controversy, revealing he was the first panelist approached by police. He explained Samay Raina was in Vancouver, Apoorva Mukhija was unreachable, and Ranveer Allahbadia had disappeared. Ashish expressed frustration at the seriousness of the situation, clarifying that even his laughter was scrutinized and had to be explained to authorities. Ashish Chanchalani recently recounted the aftermath of the 'India's Got Latent' controversy, revealing he was the first panelist approached by police. He explained Samay Raina was in Vancouver, Apoorva Mukhija was unreachable, and Ranveer Allahbadia had disappeared. Ashish expressed frustration at the seriousness of the situation, clarifying that even his laughter was scrutinized and had to be explained to authorities. Ashish Chanchalani recently opened up about the chaos that followed the India’s Got Latent controversy, revealing how the police came knocking on his door first—while fellow panelists Samay Raina and Apoorva Mukhija remained out of reach. Chaotic two months after the controversySpeaking to Faridoon Shahryar about that difficult time, Ashish said that those two months were chaotic for everyone involved in the show. He explained that Samay was in Vancouver, Apoorva couldn’t be found and was scared, and Ranveer Allahbadia had disappeared. Since Ashish was the only one in Bandra and the police knew where he lived, they came to him first, and he had to give his statement to the police.Frustration over serious situationHe further shared his frustration about how serious the situation was. He said that while many saw it as just clickbait or a reel, facing the police and government officials was very serious. When asked why he was questioned even though he didn’t say anything controversial, he explained that people might think he wasn’t involved, but sitting in front of the police and knowing everything you say is recorded makes you realize how careful you must be. He added that he didn’t say much on the show—only laughed once—but even that was noted.Ashish also revealed that the authorities carefully examined every reaction, including his laughter, which he had to explain in detail. He said he had to tell them that he was laughing because of some inside jokes with Samay and at Ranveer’s foolishness—not at the inappropriate comment Ranveer made.Ashish defends Ranveer AllahbadiaSpeaking about Ranveer’s controversial remark, Ashish said he has known Ranveer for seven years and that Ranveer often speaks jokingly. He added that while the situation was tough for him, it was even harder for Samay, Apoorva, and the others involved.After the controversy, all episodes of India’s Got Latent were taken down from YouTube. The Supreme Court initially banned Allahbadia from posting on social media but later lifted the ban.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous10 quotes on marriages by Swami Premanand Ji MaharajLifestyleSharvari Wagh brings charm to every pink detailEntertainment10 animals that can survive intense radiationLifestyleHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? Jr NTR warns fan to stay silent at War 2 event: 'Shall I leave?'
During the War 2 pre-release event in Hyderabad, Jr NTR addressed a disruptive fan, emphasizing respect during his speech. He also expressed gratitude to Yash Raj Films and humbly responded to comparisons with Hrithik Roshan, praising Roshan's talent and energy. War 2, directed by Ayan Mukerji, is set for release during Independence Day weekend 2025.

He also expressed gratitude to Yash Raj Films and humbly responded to comparisons with Hrithik Roshan, praising Roshan's talent and energy. War 2, directed by Ayan Mukerji, is set for release during Independence Day weekend 2025. During the War 2 pre-release event in Hyderabad, Jr NTR addressed a disruptive fan, emphasizing respect during his speech. He also expressed gratitude to Yash Raj Films and humbly responded to comparisons with Hrithik Roshan, praising Roshan's talent and energy. War 2, directed by Ayan Mukerji, is set for release during Independence Day weekend 2025. At the much-anticipated War 2 pre-release event in Hyderabad, Jr NTR’s Bollywood debut took an unexpected turn when he firmly addressed a disruptive fan during his speech. Amidst thousands of excited fans celebrating the upcoming action-thriller, the RRR star’s sharp warning briefly stole the spotlight. Jr NTR’s firm responseA video shared on X (formerly Twitter) shows Jr NTR saying, “Brother, should I leave? What did I tell you? Stay quiet when I speak. It won’t take me a second to put down the mic and leave the stage.” Thousands of fans had come to celebrate the RRR star’s new project, but the disruption briefly took away the attention.Hrithik and Jr NTR ignite the dance floor in 'War 2' teaser!Comparisons with Hrithik RoshanAt the event, Jr NTR thanked Yash Raj Films for the opportunity and responded to fans comparing him with Hrithik Roshan after the release of the dance number Janaab-e-Aali.Jr NTR said that comparisons between him and Hrithik Roshan can mislead fans, as their work was not a competition but rather complementary. He praised Hrithik as one of the greatest dancers in the country and appreciated the energy Hrithik brought to the set every day. Jr NTR described the 75 days of shooting as a fascinating experience where he learned a lot and recalled how Hrithik’s warm welcome made his Bollywood debut much smoother.About War 2War 2 is an upcoming action-thriller directed by Ayan Mukerji and produced by Yash Raj Films as part of its growing Spy Universe. The film stars Hrithik Roshan, returning as Kabir, alongside Jr NTR, who makes his much-anticipated Bollywood debut.Known for its high-energy stunts and intense drama, War 2 promises a pan-Indian spectacle. It will release in Hindi, Telugu, and Tamil during the Independence Day weekend of 2025. The film features thrilling action scenes, powerful dance numbers like ‘Janaab-e-Aali’, and a showdown between two strong performers. With high expectations, War 2 is set to compete with Rajinikanth’s Coolie at the box office.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Kamal Haasan receives death threat from a TV actor
Tamil superstar Kamal Haasan is facing a death threat. TV actor Ravichandran threatened Haasan over his comments against Sanatana Dharma. This left the veteran actor's fans concerned for him. Haasan talked about NEET at an event, sparking outrage on social media. The BJP called for a boycott of Haasan's films.
Kamal Haasan's remarks over Sanatan Dharma land him in trouble; receives a death threat from a TV actor | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesKamal Haasan's remarks over Sanatan Dharma land him in trouble; receives a death threat from a TV actorTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKamal Haasan's remarks over Sanatan Dharma land him in trouble; receives a death threat from a TV actorTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:07 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeTamil superstar Kamal Haasan is facing a death threat. TV actor Ravichandran threatened Haasan over his comments against Sanatana Dharma. This left the veteran actor's fans concerned for him. Haasan talked about NEET at an event, sparking outrage on social media. The BJP called for a boycott of Haasan's films.   Tamil superstar Kamal Haasan has received a death threat for a TV actor over his recent comments on Sanatana Dharma. His remarks sparked outrage on social media, and soon, that turned into boycott calls. Reportedly, actor Ravichandran has threatened to kill the veteran star over his statements.Kamal Haasan receives death threats from a TV actorAccording to News 18, in a YouTube interview, Ravichandran called Kamal Haasan a "naive" politician. The actor stated that he would "slit" the latter's throat for his comments against Sanatan. As a result, fans are concerned about the 'Indian 2' star's safety.What exactly happened? Kamal Haasan' statementAccording to the report, at the 15-year celebration of Tamil star Suriya's NGO, Kamal Haasan criticised the Centre's over National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET). The actor, who is also a Rajya Sabha MP now, said, "In this war, only education has the power to change the nation. It’s the only weapon that can break the chains of dictatorship and Sanatana."He urged everyone and asked not to pick any weapons, as he feels one cannot win with that. The veteran actor added, "Because you will be defeated by majoritarianism; ignorant majoritarians will defeat you."Consequences of Kamal Haasan's remarksSoon, the Bhartiya Janata Party of Tamil Nadu called for a boycott of films starring Kamal Haasan, even if they are on OTT or in theatres. BJP state secretary Amar Prasad Reddy took to social media to share a video in which he said, "Earlier it was Udhayanidhi Stalin, and now it is Kamal Haasan who wants to destroy Sanatana Dharma. Let’s teach them a lesson."Kamal Haasan's projectsThe actor was last seen in the film titled 'Thug Life', directed by Mani Ratnam. The film also featured Silambarasan, Trisha Krishnan, Aishwarya Lekshmi, Abhirami, Ashok Selvan, Joju George, Nassar, Mahesh Manjrekar, Ali Fazal, Sanjana Krishnamoorthy and Tanikella Bharani. It was released in theatres on June 5, 2025.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. John on 'Saiyaara': Hats off to Mohit, but major credit to…
John Abraham, while promoting 'Tehran', lauded director Mohit Suri's dedication and Aditya Chopra's faith in newcomers for the success of 'Saiyaara'. The actor emphasised his support for theatrical releases and wished continued success for films bringing audiences back to cinemas. Read the full article to know what the actor said about the Mohit Suri's film.
John Abraham on the massive success of 'Saiyaara': Hats off to Mohit Suri, but major credit to… | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodJohn Abraham on the massive success of 'Saiyaara': Hats off to Mohit Suri, but major credit to…TrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionJohn Abraham on the massive success of 'Saiyaara': Hats off to Mohit Suri, but major credit to…TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 17:17 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeJohn Abraham, while promoting 'Tehran', lauded director Mohit Suri's dedication and Aditya Chopra's faith in newcomers for the success of 'Saiyaara'. The actor emphasised his support for theatrical releases and wished continued success for films bringing audiences back to cinemas. Read the full article to know what the actor said about the Mohit Suri's film.  John Abraham is gearing up for the release of his upcoming film 'Tehran'. The actor is currently busy with the promotional interviews for the same. During one such conversation, the actor expressed that he is disheartened that his movie is not releasing in theatres. On the other hand, he also shared his thoughts about the massive success of the film 'Saiyaara'.John Abraham gives credit to THIS person for the success of 'Saiyaara'In an interview with India Today, John expressed that he is happy to know that the film is doing "so well." The 'Pathaan' actor stated that he would give credit to the director of the film, Mohit Suri. According to John, Mohit went all out for the film.EXCLUSIVE: Mohit Suri Spills On 20 Years In Bollywood - Ahaan & Aneet, Alia Bhatt Dream Collab & MoreAdmiring the filmmaker, the actor further shared that he is in "love with Mohit as a person." Calling the director a "darling," John added that everyone said that they are celebrating his success.PollDo you think 'Saiyaara' deserves the success it has achieved?Absolutely, great film!Not really, overrated.John Abraham went on to say, "So, hats off to him. But major credit to Aditya Chopra for getting a film out theatrically with two newcomers." Praising the producer, the actor further said, "His faith in newcomers worked."John didn't stop there, as he wished more success for the film. Expressing his love for cinema halls, he said, "I want all these films to run because I want people to come back to the theatres."More about 'Tehran'Co-produced by Dinesh Vijan, 'Tehran' also stars Neeru Bajwa and Manushi Chhillar in key roles. As per the reports, the movie is based on the 2012 attacks on Israeli diplomats. Directed by Arun Gopalan, the film is scheduled to release on the OTT platform on August 14, 2025.More about 'Saiyaara'The Mohit Suri-directed and Aditya Chopra-backed film stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda in the lead roles. The film has raked in Rs 318 crore in India until now. 'Saiyaara' was released in theatres on July 18, 2025.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Athiya Shetty shares birthday wish for Suniel Shetty
Athiya Shetty shared a heartwarming birthday message for her father, Suniel Shetty, on Instagram, featuring a picture with his granddaughter, Evaarah. Celebrities like Shilpa Shetty and Jackie Shroff also extended their wishes. Suniel recently attended the India vs England match in London with his family, celebrating India's win and KL Rahul's performance.

Celebrities like Shilpa Shetty and Jackie Shroff also extended their wishes. Suniel recently attended the India vs England match in London with his family, celebrating India's win and KL Rahul's performance. Athiya Shetty wishes "best father and Ajja" Suniel Shetty on actor's birthday  Athiya Shetty, who recently embraced motherhood, has extended a sweet birthday message for her father, actor Suniel Shetty. As the 'Hera Pheri' star turned a year older today, heartwarming wishes have been pouring in, with the most special one from his daughter. Suniel Shetty Gets Slammed for His Views | Daughter Athiya Drops a Brutal Reality CheckAthiya took to her Instagram stories and dedicated birthday messages to Suniel Shetty. Along with a picture of the actor with her daughter, Evaarah, she wrote, "Happy birthday to the best father and now the best Ajja. We love you sooo much! Thank you for all that you are."She followed up with an adorable collage of pictures, including one from her childhood days and another of her Haldi ceremony. The father and daughter appeared to be sharing an endearing and fun bond in the pictures. Celebrities join in the celebrationsMany other celebrities also wished Suniel on his birthday. Shilpa Shetty penned a heartfelt note for her 'Dhadkan' co-star that read, "Happppyyy Birthday SHETTYYYYYYYY!!!! May the Universe continue to shower you with love, abundance, and great health, my dearest. Loads of love."Jackie Shroff also wished the actor in his signature style, calling Suniel the "Asli Bhidu Forever."Suniel Shetty was recently in London with his family, attending the India vs England match at The Oval. Both Suniel and his son, Ahan, shared moments from the match as they celebrated India's historic win. His son-in-law, KL Rahul, delivered an amazing performance, emerging as the third-highest run-getter in the series. With a film career spanning over three decades, Suniel Shetty was among the leading stars of the 1990s and 2000s. On the work front, Suniel was recently seen in Amazon MXPlayer's 'Hunter Season 2.' The show also features Jackie Shroff, Anusha Dandekar, and Barkha Bisht in prominent roles. He is next set to reprise the iconic character of 'Shyam' in 'Hera Pheri 3'.End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? ‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ mints USD 1 million in North America
Mahavatar Narsimha, the animated mythological film, has achieved remarkable success, crossing USD 1 million in North America. Its popularity among the diaspora is evident, highlighting the appeal of Indian stories. Domestically, the film has earned Rs 168 crore, with the Hindi version surpassing Rs 100 crore, a first for an Indian animated film.
‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ roars past USD 1 million in North America, becomes 6th biggest Hindi hit of the year in India | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-office‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ roars past USD 1 million in North America, becomes 6th biggest Hindi hit of the year in IndiaTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office Collection‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ roars past USD 1 million in North America, becomes 6th biggest Hindi hit of the year in IndiaTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 15:36 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMahavatar Narsimha, the animated mythological film, has achieved remarkable success, crossing USD 1 million in North America. Its popularity among the diaspora is evident, highlighting the appeal of Indian stories. Domestically, the film has earned Rs 168 crore, with the Hindi version surpassing Rs 100 crore, a first for an Indian animated film. Mahavatar Narsimha, the animated mythological film, has achieved remarkable success, crossing USD 1 million in North America. Its popularity among the diaspora is evident, highlighting the appeal of Indian stories. Domestically, the film has earned Rs 168 crore, with the Hindi version surpassing Rs 100 crore, a first for an Indian animated film. Ashwin Kumar's Mahavatar Narsimha is proving to be nothing short of a box office juggernaut. The mythological animated spectacle has now crossed the coveted USD 1 million milestone in North America, cementing its place as one of the most successful Indian films overseas this year.The film had been on a steady upward trend since release, but the weekend proved to be a turning point in its overseas performance. Till Friday the film had earned about USD 585,000 and Saturday numbers were tracking between USD 250,000–300,000 collection and even on Sunday the numbers were close to USD 250,000. And with that the film has finally crossed the USD 1 million mark, an achievement that underlines its growing popularity among the diaspora.The North America market is a very mature market when it comes to animation films thanks to Hollywood films, but for a film that is rooted in Indian history goes on to show people are willing to step out if the film has a good message. Mahavatar Narsimha tells the story of Hiranyakashyap and his son Prahlad and the eternal battle of good vs evil.'Mahavatar Narsimha' Rockets to ₹37 Crore in Six Days—Animated Epic Becomes Surprise HitWhile Mahavatar Narsimha’s North American rampage is making headlines, its performance back home in India is equally — if not more — impressive. The film has already raked in Rs 168 crore domestically of which it’s Hindi version has collected over Rs 126 crore, making it the sixth biggest Hindi hit of 2025 so far. In doing so, it has achieved a historic milestone — becoming the first-ever Hindi animated film to cross the Rs 100 crore mark at the Indian box office.The film is expected to have a slow run with the onset of the weekend as majority of screens would be given to Rajinikanth’s Coolie and Hrithik Roshan, Jr.NTR and Kiara Advani’s War 2 as both films are clashing on 14th August. Between the two films the box office has earned more than USD 2.2 million dollars and is expected to be the biggest weekend for Indian films in the circuit. Not SRK! This star was first in line for Chak De! India
Shah Rukh Khan delivered a memorable performance in 'Chak De! India,' but the role was initially offered to Salman Khan. Salman declined due to his then-prevailing image of doing commercial movies, fearing his fans would expect a typical heroic portrayal, which didn't align with the film's serious tone and the character of a hockey coach.
Not Shah Rukh Khan! Guess which superstar was first in line for ‘Chak De! Guess which superstar was first in line for ‘Chak De! India’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShah Rukh Khan delivered a memorable performance in 'Chak De! India,' but the role was initially offered to Salman Khan. Salman declined due to his then-prevailing image of doing commercial movies, fearing his fans would expect a typical heroic portrayal, which didn't align with the film's serious tone and the character of a hockey coach.  Shah Rukh Khan, who is known for his unmatched charisma, has given multiple hits over the decades. His versatility has translated into several cinematic gems, an example of the same is ‘Chak De! India.’ However, did you know that Shah Rukh Khan was not the first choice for ‘Chak De! India,’ but another Khan of Bollywood? This 2007 sports drama was initially offered to the ‘Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan’ actor Salman Khan.Why did Salman Khan reject ‘Chak De! India’?Salman Khan, who is known for his sense of humour, during the promotions of ‘Sultan’ in 2016, joked, “I left it because even Shah Rukh Khan should be a part of a few great films.”Shah Rukh Khan Injured on Set of KING | One-Month Break, US Treatment, Shoot HaltedHe later added that back then, his fans had heroic expectations, and the image of Kabir Khan, the sports coach, didn’t fit the bill. “When I was offered Chak De, my image was totally different as I was doing Partner and all those kinds of films. My only thing in Chak De was that my fans would expect me to wear a wig and win the match for India, which would not go for the film. That was not my genre at that point in time,” said Salman.He continued, “It was a more serious kind of film, and I was doing more of a commercial kind of cinema, which I am still doing. I would never move out of the commercial cinema zone, but it is just that there would be a lot of meaningful cinema in the commercial zone.”‘Chak De! India’Released in 2007, ‘Chak De! India’ told the gritty, emotional journey of a women’s hockey team, their struggles, their wins, and the unbreakable bond that made them champions. The story drew inspiration from the life of former hockey player Mir Ranjan Negi. Shah Rukh Khan took on the role of a coach looking to redeem his reputation, a choice he accepted quickly as he had played hockey in college.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. NOT Salman, SRK but THIS actor to have cameo in War 2
War 2 is generating excitement with Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's collaboration. Salman Khan's Tiger and Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan will not appear. Bobby Deol will enter the YRF Spy Universe as a key villain. The film will set up the next chapter, Alpha. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, War 2 releases on August 14, 2025.
Salman Khan’s ‘Tiger’ and Shah Rukh Khan’s ‘Pathaan’ will NOT make cameo in ‘War 2’; Bobby Deol to get epic Spy Universe entry: Report | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodSalman Khan’s ‘Tiger’ and Shah Rukh Khan’s ‘Pathaan’ will NOT make cameo in ‘War 2’; Bobby Deol to get epic Spy Universe entry: ReportTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSalman Khan’s ‘Tiger’ and Shah Rukh Khan’s ‘Pathaan’ will NOT make cameo in ‘War 2’; Bobby Deol to get epic Spy Universe entry: ReportTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:11 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWar 2 is generating excitement with Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's collaboration. Salman Khan's Tiger and Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan will not appear. Bobby Deol will enter the YRF Spy Universe as a key villain. The film will set up the next chapter, Alpha. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, War 2 releases on August 14, 2025.  The much-awaited ‘War 2’ is already creating buzz for bringing Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR together on screen for the first time. Putting an end to the rumour mills with a surprise twist, reports suggest that Salman Khan’s Tiger and Shah Rukh Khan’s Pathaan won’t be making appearances. Instead, Bobby Deol will make a game-changing entry.No Tiger or Pathaan cameo this timeFor months, there had been talk that ‘War 2’ would feature explosive end-credit cameos from the YRF Spy Universe’s biggest names, Salman Khan’s Tiger or Shah Rukh Khan’s Pathaan. However, sources now reveal that neither of the fan-favourite agents will show up.Hrithik and Jr NTR ignite the dance floor in 'War 2' teaser!According to a Bollywood Hungama report, “War 2 won’t feature either of Tiger or Pathaan's character portrayed by Salman Khan and Shah Rukjh Khan respectively, however, their names will be used at some key junctures of the film. The end credit sequence of War 2 will act as a build up for the next chapter of YRF Spy Universe – Alpha. Aditya Chopra is staying true to his vision of continuing the story forward, rather than opting for gimmicks by bringing all 3 superstars in the same film. He is reserving the union of all 3 superstars for a mega project, which is in the development stage.”Setting up the next big chapterThe absence of Tiger and Pathaan isn’t just a missing star moment, it’s part of a bigger plan. The end credits will lead directly into the next spy thriller, ‘Alpha’, instead of being a flashy cameo scene. This means fans can expect the storyline to keep flowing naturally, rather than being interrupted by quick appearances.Bobby Deol enters with a bangRather than banking on Salman or Shah Rukh’s brief appearances, the makers have decided to use ‘War 2’ to introduce a new and important character. And it’s none other than Bobby Deol.The report further states, “With War 2, Aditya Chopra will be establishing Bobby Deol to the Universe. It’s an epic introduction to Bobby Deol’s character, who is one of the main villains in the timeline going forward. Aditya Chopra is known to go against the tide, and instead of establishing his two female leads of Alpha, Alia Bhatt and Sharvari – he is going ahead by unleashing the negative force of the film, Bobby Deol.”About ‘War 2’ and its big starsDirected by Ayan Mukerji, ‘War 2’ is the sixth film in the YRF Spy Universe. It is set to release in Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu on 14 August 2025. The movie stars Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani in key roles.The story sees a powerful face-off between Hrithik Roshan’s Major Kabir Dhaliwal and Jr NTR’s Vikram. Both are Indian spies, but their beliefs about patriotism clash sharply, turning their rivalry into a battle of ideals as well as action. Kiara Advani plays Kavya Luthra, a central figure who plays an important role in how events unfold.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Aishwarya-Abhishek pose for a sweet selfie with fan
Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan recently returned to Mumbai after a family vacation, delighting fans with their heartwarming interactions. Videos circulating online capture the couple posing with a fan, showcasing their warmth and style. Their airport appearance with daughter Aaradhya further emphasized their strong family bond, complemented by Abhishek's thoughtful gestures.
Aishwarya Rai leans on Abhishek Bachchan as they pose for a sweet selfie with fan in UNSEEN video from their vacation: WATCH | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAishwarya Rai leans on Abhishek Bachchan as they pose for a sweet selfie with fan in UNSEEN video from their vacation: WATCHTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionAishwarya Rai leans on Abhishek Bachchan as they pose for a sweet selfie with fan in UNSEEN video from their vacation: WATCHTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 12:50 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAbhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan recently returned to Mumbai after a family vacation, delighting fans with their heartwarming interactions. Videos circulating online capture the couple posing with a fan, showcasing their warmth and style. Their airport appearance with daughter Aaradhya further emphasized their strong family bond, complemented by Abhishek's thoughtful gestures.  Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan are once again giving fans major family goals. Fresh from a holiday with their daughter Aaradhya, the couple was spotted returning to Mumbai. Now, some unseen videos from their vacation, including a heart-warming fan moment, are doing the rounds online and winning hearts.Smiles all around in fan selfieOn Sunday, a fan account posted two videos of the couple posing with a fan. In the first clip, the ‘Jodhaa Akbar’ actress was dressed in an all-black outfit, wearing sunglasses, and casually flipped her hair while posing for the camera. The second showed her leaning on Abhishek to fit into a selfie with the fan at the airport. Both of them smiled warmly for the picture, looking every bit the stylish pair.Abhishek Bachchan hails Aishwarya & Aaradhya|'My daughter does not use social media'Fans can’t stop gushing over themThe couple’s interaction quickly drew love from admirers online. One person commented, “Aishwarya still looks damn pretty.” Another simply wrote, “Cute.” Someone else added, “So beautiful and always kind.” The response proved the couple’s timeless appeal.Family moment on return to MumbaiOn Sunday, video surfaced showing Aishwarya, Abhishek and Aaradhya exiting Mumbai airport after their trip. Aaradhya, looking cheerful, held her mom’s hand as they walked together. The ‘Bunty Aur Babli’ actor walked slightly ahead but stopped to wait and only closed the car door once Aishwarya and Aaradhya were seated. It was a small but thoughtful gesture that fans loved seeing.Abhishek’s recent and upcoming workAbhishek was last seen in the film ‘Kaalidhar Laapata’, also starring Zeeshan Ayub and Daivik Bhagela. His acting won praise from critics and audiences. His next project is Siddharth Anand’s ‘King’, which also stars Shah Rukh Khan, Suhana Khan and Saurabh Shukla in important roles. The film is currently in production.Aishwarya’s last box office hitAishwarya was last seen in Mani Ratnam’s 2023 film ‘Ponniyin Selvan II’. The film, which featured Vikram, Trisha Krishnan, Karthi and Sobhita Dhulipala, became a commercial success.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Suniel Shetty at 64: Check Bollywood’s ‘Anna’ Rs 450 crore networth
Suniel Shetty, fondly known as Anna, has transitioned from a leading action star to a versatile figure with a ₹125 crore net worth. Beyond his 30-year acting career spanning 150 films, Shetty's ventures include hospitality with restaurants like H2O and Little Italy.
Suniel Shetty at 64: Bollywood’s ‘Anna’ who earned Rs.300 crore on-screen and built Rs.125 crore empire off-screen; Check out his networth | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodSuniel Shetty at 64: Bollywood’s ‘Anna’ who earned Rs.300 crore on-screen and built Rs.125 crore empire off-screen; Check out his networthTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSuniel Shetty at 64: Bollywood’s ‘Anna’ who earned Rs.300 crore on-screen and built Rs.125 crore empire off-screen; Check out his networthTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:21 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSuniel Shetty, fondly known as Anna, has transitioned from a leading action star to a versatile figure with a ₹125 crore net worth. Beyond his 30-year acting career spanning 150 films, Shetty's ventures include hospitality with restaurants like H2O and Little Italy.  Suniel Shetty has had an enduring Bollywood career spanning over thirty years and is also popularly known as Anna. Keeping his brand as one of the leading action stars of the 1990s and 2000s, he has transformed from a film star into a multi-faceted person. In addition to acting, he is an entrepreneur, philanthropist, and fitness aficionado, and he continues to tap into everything he pursues. His zeal and character for performing, as well as his disciplined body, have all gained him a fan base that spans generations.Suniel Shetty and his strong careerSuniel is still going strong, from delivering impactful dialogues to making calculated career decisions. As recently as 2025, his estimated net worth was at about ₹125 crore (almost $15 million). His income stream is as varied as his career has been, including films, endorsements, hospitality, real estate, and fitness. As an actor for more than 30 years in over 150 films, he has earned an estimated ₹300 crore in acting alone, which will be enhanced by his other business interests.Suniel Shetty Gets Slammed for His Views | Daughter Athiya Drops a Brutal Reality CheckA pioneer in the hospitality business in Bollywood, Suniel launched H2O (a popular restaurant and bar in Bandra, Mumbai), which grew extremely popular in a very short span of time after it was opened, due in part to the number of celebrities that frequented his restaurant. After its successful run, Suniel scaled down H2O and turned it into the restaurant Little Italy, which offered good, authentic Italian food for both high-end clients and the general public.PollDo you think Suniel Shetty's transition from actor to entrepreneur is inspiring?Yes, absolutely!No, not really.In terms of acting, Suniel most recently appeared in the show 'Hunter 2' on Amazon MX Player, playing the character of ACP Vikram Sinha, a man trying to find and rescue his kidnapped daughter from a psychopath known as The Salesman, played by Jackie Shroff. Throughout the series there is insight into Vikram's past, and a balance of high-octane action and emotional reference is present.Looking ahead, Suniel is part of Welcome to the Jungle, the third film in the Welcome franchise, alongside Akshay Kumar, Paresh Rawal, and an ensemble cast. He will also reprise his beloved role in 'Hera Pheri 3', with filming now back on track after delays.Some of Suniel Shetty’s most iconic dialogues:“Main tumhe bhool jaon yeh ho nahi sakta … aur tum mujhe bhool jao, yeh main hone nahi doonga.” (Dhadkan)“Dilwale toh bahut dekhe, lekin pyar mein joh pagal ho jaye … aise dilwale ko aaj pehli baar dekha.” (Dilwale)“Mohabbat aur paagalpan ka bohot purana rishta hai.” (Border)“Ek sachche desh bhakt ko hum fauj se nikaal sakte hain, lekin uske dil se desh bhakti nahi.” (Jai Ho)“Tumhare haathon mein woh rekhayein hai, jo mere haathon mein nahi hai … Tumhare maathe pe woh lakeerein hai, jo mere maathe par nahi hai.” (Dhadkan)We see Suniel Shetty moving from the cinema to the corporate world, signifying the fact that true stars rise to the occasion when faced with challenges and turn out to be more adaptable than you think. This story has impacted not just young actors but anyone who's trying to be dynamic and still true to their heritage!About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV?
