When director Ravi revealed on-set tension between Raaj and Dilip
The 1991 film 'Saudagar' brought Dilip Kumar and Raaj Kumar together, though a known tension existed between them. Action director Ravi Dewan recalls Raaj Kumar's subtle acts of indifference on set, like avoiding fan interactions and causing retakes. Their cold war reportedly began during 'Paigham' in 1959. Despite their strained relationship, 'Saudagar' became a commercial success.
‘Saudagar’ Turns 34: When director Ravi Dewan revealed on-set tension between Raaj Kumar and Dilip Kumar | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood‘Saudagar’ Turns 34: When director Ravi Dewan revealed on-set tension between Raaj Kumar and Dilip KumarTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office Collection‘Saudagar’ Turns 34: When director Ravi Dewan revealed on-set tension between Raaj Kumar and Dilip KumarTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe 1991 film 'Saudagar' brought Dilip Kumar and Raaj Kumar together, though a known tension existed between them. Action director Ravi Dewan recalls Raaj Kumar's subtle acts of indifference on set, like avoiding fan interactions and causing retakes. Their cold war reportedly began during 'Paigham' in 1959. Despite their strained relationship, 'Saudagar' became a commercial success. 12 When 'Saudagar' hit theatres in 1991, audiences were mesmerised by the rare pairing of two cinematic giants Dilip Kumar and Raaj Kumar. On-screen, their chemistry was magnetic, but behind the scenes, things were far from cordial.Speaking on Sutradhar with Vineet Rai, according to veteran action director Ravi Dewan, the tension between the two often surfaced in subtle yet telling ways during filming. Dewan recalled an intense death scene where all eyes were fixed on Dilip Kumar, except for Raaj Kumar’s. With no shot scheduled for him that day, Raaj quietly placed his chair eight feet away, facing the opposite direction. This was seemingly indifferent to the moment.Saira Banu Shares Rare Photos of Dilip Kumar & Lata MangeshkarThe waterfall incident that spoke volumesOne particularly memorable episode took place during a shoot at a hill station. While couples and fans flocked to click photos with Dilip Kumar, Raaj Kumar wandered off to a nearby waterfall. There, he pulled up a chair and sat knee-deep in the icy water. When director Subhash Ghai eventually asked why, Raaj quipped, “Yahan photo kheenchne koi nahi aayega” (“No one will come here to take photos”). For Dewan, this was Raaj in his element — unpredictable, calculated, and often aloof from the crowd’s attention.PollWhich actor do you think had the more compelling screen presence in 'Saudagar'?Dilip KumarRaaj KumarClashes, retakes, and an old grudgeRaaj Kumar’s quirks extended beyond avoiding fan interactions. Dewan revealed that in one rope-pulling scene with Amrish Puri, Raaj insisted on multiple retakes despite the first take going perfectly. In a punch scene, he delivered such force that it caused Puri genuine discomfort. Dilip and Raaj's cold war reportedly began during 'Paigham' (1959), when Raaj allegedly struck Dilip too hard in a scene, prompting the latter to vow never to work with his contemporaries again. Fate, however, had other plans, reuniting them for 'Saudagar'.Despite their personal distance, 'Saudagar' emerged as a commercial success.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? Salman Khan proposes ‘Chor Police League’
Salman Khan, known for his Bollywood stardom and down-to-earth nature, recently expressed his desire to revive traditional children's games by starting leagues for activities like marbles, gilli-danda, hide-and-seek, and cops and robbers. He also mentioned a 'doctor-doctor' league.
Salman Khan proposes ‘Chor Police League’ to revive nostalgia of traditional childhood games | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodSalman Khan proposes ‘Chor Police League’ to revive nostalgia of traditional childhood gamesTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSalman Khan proposes ‘Chor Police League’ to revive nostalgia of traditional childhood gamesTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:36 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSalman Khan, known for his Bollywood stardom and down-to-earth nature, recently expressed his desire to revive traditional children's games by starting leagues for activities like marbles, gilli-danda, hide-and-seek, and cops and robbers. He also mentioned a 'doctor-doctor' league.  Salman Khan is one of the biggest stars of Bollywood. With several blockbusters under his belt, his no-nonsense attitude and down-to-earth demeanor, he has been ruling the industry for decades. However, at heart, he is still a kid, and he has proved that on multiple occasions. This pookie side of him recently also hogged the limelight when the actor got candid about his love for childhood games.Here's what happened...Salman Khan Opens Up on Reviving Salim Khan’s Vintage Triumph After Finding It in JunkyardSalman Khan would like to start a 'chor-police' leagueSalman Khan recently attended a sports event, where he spoke about bringing back the traditional children's recreational games. According to IANS, speaking at the event, Salman Khan mentioned, "Main goti league kholunga, kanche, main gilly danda league kholunga is prakaar ke league khelunga, chain cook, hide and seek league, chor police league, main in sab league main interested hun. Aur phir educated log hai toh, main doctor-doctor league kholna chahunga." (I will start a marbles league, a gilli-danda league. I want to play these kinds of leagues-chain cook, hide and seek, and cops and robbers. And since there are educated people, I would also like to start a "doctor-doctor" league."Salman Khan's upcoming workMeanwhile, on the work front, Salman Khan is all set to make his return to the small screen with 'Bigg Boss' season 19. It is one of the most talked-about celebrity reality TV shows, and it will premiere on August 24.PollAre you excited for Salman Khan's return to 'Bigg Boss' season 19?Absolutely!Not reallyOn the cinematic front, he was last seen in the action-drama 'Sikandar.' Directed by A. R. Murugadoss, the film also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Kajal Aggarwal, Sharman Joshi, Sathyaraj, Jatin Sarna, Sanjay Kapoor, Prateik Babbar, and Kishore. Next on his plate is 'Battle of Galwan.' Directed by Apoorva Lakhia, the movie chronicles the battle between Indian and Chinese troops back in 2020 in the Galwan Valley, a disputed border region in Ladakh.Though it is one of the highly anticipated movies of 2025, it has hit a roadblock recently. According to a Mid-day report, the movie's Mumbai schedule has been canceled. However, the director took the creative decision and has opted to shoot in Ladakh between August 22 and September 3, to avoid long gaps in the shooting schedule.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. ‘Mahavatar Narasimha’ becomes sixth biggest Hindi hit of 2025
Mahavatar Narasimha achieves a box office milestone. The film secures the sixth position among the top-grossing Hindi films of 2025. It surpasses Sky Force and Sikandar in collections. Strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews contribute to its success. The movie's total collection across languages reaches Rs 168.75 crore. It faces a major clash with Coolie and War 2 soon.
‘Mahavatar Narasimha’ overtakes Akshay Kumar’s ‘Sky Force’ and Salman Khan’s ‘Sikandar’ to become sixth biggest Hindi hit of 2025 | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews‘Mahavatar Narasimha’ overtakes Akshay Kumar’s ‘Sky Force’ and Salman Khan’s ‘Sikandar’ to become sixth biggest Hindi hit of 2025‘Mahavatar Narasimha’ overtakes Akshay Kumar’s ‘Sky Force’ and Salman Khan’s ‘Sikandar’ to become sixth biggest Hindi hit of 2025TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 10:23 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMahavatar Narasimha achieves a box office milestone. The film secures the sixth position among the top-grossing Hindi films of 2025. It surpasses Sky Force and Sikandar in collections. Strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews contribute to its success. The movie's total collection across languages reaches Rs 168.75 crore. It faces a major clash with Coolie and War 2 soon. Mahavatar Narasimha achieves a box office milestone. The film secures the sixth position among the top-grossing Hindi films of 2025. It surpasses Sky Force and Sikandar in collections. Strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews contribute to its success. The movie's total collection across languages reaches Rs 168.75 crore. It faces a major clash with Coolie and War 2 soon. Ashwin Kumar's Mahavatar Narasimha has pulled off yet another box office milestone. With its total Hindi collections now standing at Rs 126.15 crore, the animation mythological drama has officially climbed to the sixth spot among the highest-grossing Hindi films of 2025. In doing so, it has overtaken Akshay Kumar’s Sky Force (Rs 113.62 crore) and Salman Khan’s Sikandar (Rs 110.36 crore).The film’s box office trajectory has been nothing short of remarkable in the Hindi belt. Opening modestly at Rs 1.35 crore on Day 1, the film picked up steam over the first weekend with Rs 3.25 crore on Day 2 and Rs 6.8 crore on Day 3. The strong word-of-mouth, coupled with glowing reviews for its performances and action sequences, helped it hold steady through the weekdays and ended week 1 with Rs 32.45 crore in Hindi. The momentum didn’t slow in the second week as well where it added another Rs 54.95 crore to its kitty. What really sealed its place among the year’s top earners was its third weekend. Day 16 brought in Rs 16 crore, Day 17 stood at Rs 17.5 crore as per early trends, thus taking the overall collection of the film to Rs 126.15 for its Hindi version,meaning the third Sunday’s haul was strong enough to propel the film past both Sky Force and Sikandar. The film has been released in multiple languages and its overall collection across languages stands at Rs 168.75 crore. With this latest milestone, Mahavatar Narasimha now sits behind only five other Hindi releases of the year like Chhava, Saiyaara, Sitaara Zameen Par , Housefull 5 and Raid 2. The film still has three more days before the biggest clash of Indian Cinema takes place on 14th August as Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj’s Coolie clashes with Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR’s War 2. It would be a case study as to how this now animation giant holds out against these big names and how much box office collection it can make. About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. Divya Dutta hails SRK’s first National Award win
Shah Rukh Khan's first National Award for 'Jawan' has sparked celebrations, including from his 'Veer-Zaara' co-star Divya Dutta. Dutta, a National Award winner herself, expressed her admiration for Khan's performance and noted how such accolades elevate industry perception. She reflected on her own win for 'Irada', emphasizing the honor and increased recognition it brought.

Dutta, a National Award winner herself, expressed her admiration for Khan's performance and noted how such accolades elevate industry perception. She reflected on her own win for 'Irada', emphasizing the honor and increased recognition it brought.  Shah Rukh Khan’s dazzling career has finally scored a long-awaited milestone – his first National Award. Joining the celebrations is his ‘Veer-Zaara’ co-star Divya Dutta, who couldn’t hide her joy. The actress, a National Award winner herself for ‘Irada’, opened up about the honour, how it changes industry perception, and why SRK’s big win for ‘Jawan’ is a moment worth savouring.Divya expressed her deep admiration for SRKIn an interview with The Indian Express, Divya expressed her admiration for Shah Rukh and his performance in ‘Jawan’. She said, “I keep my love for him intact and absolutely adore the man. I’m so, so happy for him. I think he was amazing in ‘Jawan’. I’m super happy about the fact that he’s got his first national award.”Shah Rukh Khan Injured on Set of KING | One-Month Break, US Treatment, Shoot HaltedThe actress reflected on her own winDivya knows the feeling of receiving a National Award. She won Best Supporting Actress for director Aparnaa Singh’s ‘Irada’ in 2017. Looking back on that moment, she said, “It’s not just a fond memory. Firstly, it’s such a huge honour. Secondly, of course, the public perception of you changes, and even among industry insiders, it does. They take you a tad bit more seriously (after such wins). I’m not saying that they weren’t taking me seriously, but it’s definitely a feather in the cap that you’ll always be proud of.”PollWhich aspect of Shah Rukh Khan's career do you admire the most?His versatility.His dedication.SRK’s moment at the 71st National AwardsThe 71st National Film Awards were announced on August 1 at the National Media Centre in New Delhi. The awards distribution ceremony will be held later. Shah Rukh’s performance in ‘Jawan’ earned him the honour, making this a landmark year in his journey.On the work front, Divya Dutta was last seen in the hit film ‘Chhaava’, where she starred alongside Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna. . Meanwhile, Shah Rukh Khan is currently gearing up for his upcoming action-thriller ‘King’, in which he will share the screen with his daughter, Suhana Khan. Directed by Siddharth Anand, the much-anticipated film has already generated a buzz among fans.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Saiyaara is just Rs 2.34 crore away from surpassing Bajrangi Bhaijaan
Mohit Suri's musical romance 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is on the verge of surpassing Salman Khan's 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' at the box office. With India net collections at Rs 318 crore after 24 days, it needs just Rs 2.34 crore more to claim the 14th spot among highest-grossing Hindi films.
Mohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ is just Rs 2.34 crore away from surpassing Salman Khan’s ‘Bajrangi Bhaijaan’ to become the 14th biggest hit in Hindi cinema | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-officeMohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ is just Rs 2.34 crore away from surpassing Salman Khan’s ‘Bajrangi Bhaijaan’ to become the 14th biggest hit in Hindi cinemaTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionMohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ is just Rs 2.34 crore away from surpassing Salman Khan’s ‘Bajrangi Bhaijaan’ to become the 14th biggest hit in Hindi cinemaTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:28 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMohit Suri's musical romance 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is on the verge of surpassing Salman Khan's 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' at the box office. With India net collections at Rs 318 crore after 24 days, it needs just Rs 2.34 crore more to claim the 14th spot among highest-grossing Hindi films. Mohit Suri's musical romance 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is on the verge of surpassing Salman Khan's 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' at the box office. With India net collections at Rs 318 crore after 24 days, it needs just Rs 2.34 crore more to claim the 14th spot among highest-grossing Hindi films. Mohit Suri’s romantic musical Saiyaara, led by debutant Ahaan Panday and newcomer Aneet Padda, is just a whisker away from a major box office milestone. After 24 days in cinemas, the film’s India net collections stand at an impressive Rs 318 crore, meaning it needs only Rs 2.34 crore more to surpass Salman Khan’s Bajrangi Bhaijaan (Rs 320.34 crore) and claim the 14th spot among the highest-grossing Hindi films of all time.The journey of Saiyaara at the box office has been nothing short of phenomenal, especially considering it was a love story headlined by two fresh faces. The film opened strongly with Rs 21.5 crore on its first Friday, powered by positive reviews and strong buzz about Mohit Suri’s return to his romantic storytelling roots. Collections surged over the weekend, with Rs 26 crore on Saturday and a stellar Rs 35.75 crore on Sunday, giving it one of the highest first-weekend totals for a non-action Hindi film in recent years.EXCLUSIVE: Mohit Suri Spills On 20 Years In Bollywood - Ahaan & Aneet, Alia Bhatt Dream Collab & MoreThe momentum continued through the week, with Monday bringing in Rs 24 crore, followed by Rs 25 crore on Tuesday—a rare instance of a weekday surpassing Monday numbers. Wednesday and Thursday saw slight dips to Rs 21.5 crore and Rs 19 crore respectively, but the film closed Week 1 with Rs 172.75 crore, a remarkable start by any standard.In Week 2, Saiyaara maintained steady collections. While Friday saw a marginal drop to Rs 18 crore, the weekend again brought in big numbers—Rs 26.5 crore on Saturday and Rs 30 crore on Sunday. However, the Monday crash to Rs 9.25 crore marked the start of its gradual slowdown, with Tuesday at Rs 10 crore, Wednesday at Rs 7.5 crore, and Thursday at Rs 6.5 crore, ending the week at Rs 107.75 crore. Even so, this brought the 14-day total to a staggering Rs 280.5 crore.Week 3 was slower, beginning with Rs 4.5 crore on Friday and peaking at Rs 8 crore on Sunday. The weekdays stayed low, averaging around Rs 2–Rs 2.5 crore per day, for a weekly haul of Rs 28.25 crore.Now in its fourth week, Saiyaara is holding better than expected. Friday and Saturday brought Rs 2 crore and Rs 3.5 crore respectively, and Sunday’s early estimate stands at Rs 3.75 crore. With strong weekend multipliers and continued audience interest in urban centers and multiplex chains, industry experts believe the film will cross the Rs 320 crore mark comfortably within the next few days.The film’s success has cemented Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda as promising new talents and reaffirmed Mohit Suri’s ability to deliver commercially and emotionally resonant cinema.If Saiyaara overtakes Bajrangi Bhaijaan, it will be a landmark achievement displacing a beloved Salman Khan blockbuster from it’s 14th spot to 15th spot. With just Rs 2.34 crore to go, that historic moment is now inevitable.The film is expected to attain 14th spot before the clash between Rajinikanth's Coolie and Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's War 2 takes place on 14th August. About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. When Suniel recalled career mistakes
Suniel Shetty, reflecting on his Bollywood journey, attributes his three-decade-long success to his action-hero image, which opened doors to diverse genres like comedy. He acknowledges that deviating from this persona led to missteps and a period of poor script choices, impacting his stardom.
When Suniel Shetty recalled career mistakes and admitted to losing stardom and box office grip | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWhen Suniel Shetty recalled career mistakes and admitted to losing stardom and box office gripTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandaySholayAnita AyoobDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionWhen Suniel Shetty recalled career mistakes and admitted to losing stardom and box office gripTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 13:41 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSuniel Shetty, reflecting on his Bollywood journey, attributes his three-decade-long success to his action-hero image, which opened doors to diverse genres like comedy. He acknowledges that deviating from this persona led to missteps and a period of poor script choices, impacting his stardom.  Suniel Shetty, one of Bollywood’s most beloved action stars, has never shied away from experimenting across genres, be it romance in ‘Dhadkan,’ patriotism in ‘Border,’ or comedy in 'Hera Pheri'. Yet, in a candid old interview from 2023, given during the promotions of ‘Dharavi Bank,’ Suniel admitted that it was his action-hero image that truly gave him longevity in the industry. Read on to know more.Suniel Shetty Gets Slammed for His Views | Daughter Athiya Drops a Brutal Reality CheckSuniel Shetty on career longevity In a throwback interview, veteran actor Suniel Shetty reflected on his extensive career, stating that his action-hero image was the primary reason for his three decades of success in the film industry. He explained that this persona also provided him with the chance to explore other genres, like comedy. While acknowledging that he didn't have a string of blockbuster hits, he noted that his continuous experimentation across different genres was what ultimately kept him relevant to audiences throughout his career.“The last 30 years in the industry was purely because of my action image. That gave me an opportunity to do comedy,” shared Shetty.PollWhat genre do you think Suniel Shetty excels in the most?ActionComedySuniel Shetty on downfallHowever, Suniel confessed that straying too far from his established image didn’t always work in his favor. “I failed at times when I tried to do things differently because the audience wanted to see you with a particular image,” he said. The real turning point came when he began making what he now calls “wrong choices” in scripts. Those missteps, he admitted, cost him dearly, not only did he lose stardom, but also the box-office hold he once enjoyed. “When that happens to you, trash started coming. That’s when I decided that it’s better to not do anything than do trash,” Suniel reflected.Suniel Shetty on hiatus, reflection, and the road aheadThe ‘Hunter’ actor revealed that a combination of “personal reasons and trash” projects kept him away from films for nearly seven to eight years. The pandemic, he has said in other conversations, further reinforced his belief in doing meaningful work rather than repetitive roles. Now, he’s back with a renewed focus on quality over quantity. Recently seen in the action thriller 'Hunter 2', Suniel’s next big outing is 'Hera Pheri 3', reuniting him with Akshay Kumar and Paresh Rawal for one of Bollywood’s most loved comedy franchises.Genelia's birthday: Riteish Deshmukh's touching post melts hearts, B-town showers loveAbout the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Coolie just USD 60K away from toppling Kabali’s record
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to break records in North America, nearing $1.86 million in premiere sales, challenging 'Kabali's' record. The film, featuring a pan-Indian cast including Nagarjuna and Aamir Khan, faces 'War 2' at the box office but boasts strong advance sales. 'Coolie' is anticipated to be a major cultural event for Tamil cinema.
Rajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ just USD 60K away from toppling ‘Kabali’ as biggest Tamil premiere in North America | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardsNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesbox-officeRajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ just USD 60K away from toppling ‘Kabali’ as biggest Tamil premiere in North AmericaTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionRajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ just USD 60K away from toppling ‘Kabali’ as biggest Tamil premiere in North AmericaTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 10:52 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to break records in North America, nearing $1.86 million in premiere sales, challenging 'Kabali's' record. The film, featuring a pan-Indian cast including Nagarjuna and Aamir Khan, faces 'War 2' at the box office but boasts strong advance sales. 'Coolie' is anticipated to be a major cultural event for Tamil cinema. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to break records in North America, nearing $1.86 million in premiere sales, challenging 'Kabali's' record. The film, featuring a pan-Indian cast including Nagarjuna and Aamir Khan, faces 'War 2' at the box office but boasts strong advance sales. 'Coolie' is anticipated to be a major cultural event for Tamil cinema. The Rajinikanth0Lokesh Kanagaraj juggernaut Coolie is on the verge of creating history in North America. With three days still to go before its August 14 premiere, the film has already raked in a staggering USD 1.60 million for it’s premiere shows in USA alone and after adding Canada numbers the collection jumps to USD 1.86 million. This put Coolie well within touching distance of the all-time Tamil record set by Kabali in 2016 with $1.92 million.Trade analysts say the pace of ticket sales points to Coolie not just breaking Kabali’s record but doing so with room to spare, potentially setting a new benchmark for Tamil cinema in the region. The massive surge in bookings over the past week signals the power of the Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj pairing, which has sent fan anticipation through the roof. The director, known for his high-octane, stylized action narratives, appears to have delivered yet another mass entertainer that has struck a chord well before release.The star-studded ensemble has only amplified the hype. Joining Rajinikanth are Telugu superstar Nagarjuna, Malayalam favorite Shoubin Shahir, Kannada legend Upendra, veteran actor Sathyaraj, and Shruti Haasan, with Bollywood icon Aamir Khan making a special cameo appearance. The sheer range of pan-Indian talent has helped Coolie transcend regional boundaries, fueling advance sales across diverse South Asian diaspora pockets in North America.Adding to the excitement is the fact that Coolie is headed for one of the year’s biggest box office clashes. The film will release alongside War 2, led by Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani, and directed by Ayan Mukerji. While War 2 has made a solid start in the USA with USD 435K in North America , Coolie currently holds a commanding lead.The stark gap between the two films’ advance sales reflects not just Coolie’s overwhelming star power but also the fierce loyalty of Rajinikanth’s overseas fanbase. His last outings in Jailer had l performed exceptionally in the circuit , but the current momentum suggests Coolie could be his biggest opener in the market yet.With just days to go, Coolie is more than a film release—it’s shaping up to be a cultural event for Tamil cinema overseas. Whether it’s the record-breaking premiere, the mega cast, or the Lokesh Kanagaraj brand of spectacle, all signs point to August 14 delivering fireworks at the North American box office.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? 'Piracy' plague: Celebrities get candid - Exclusive
Piracy significantly threatens the entertainment industry, causing substantial financial losses and impacting livelihoods. A recent report indicates a large portion of Indian media consumers access pirated content, costing the industry billions. Industry stakeholders emphasize the need for collaborative efforts, including stricter regulations and audience awareness, to combat piracy and protect the creative ecosystem, ensuring its continued growth and sustainability.
'Piracy' plague: Celebrities get candid about the threat, impact, and on taking precautionary steps ⁠- Exclusive | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Piracy' plague: Celebrities get candid about the threat, impact, and on taking precautionary steps ⁠- ExclusiveTrendingNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNamrata ShirodkarAishwarya RaiKareena KapoorKajal RaghwaniSushmita SenAhaan PandayAnita AyoobSholayDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office Collection'Piracy' plague: Celebrities get candid about the threat, impact, and on taking precautionary steps ⁠- ExclusiveNeha Vashist / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 10:33 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePiracy significantly threatens the entertainment industry, causing substantial financial losses and impacting livelihoods. A recent report indicates a large portion of Indian media consumers access pirated content, costing the industry billions. Industry stakeholders emphasize the need for collaborative efforts, including stricter regulations and audience awareness, to combat piracy and protect the creative ecosystem, ensuring its continued growth and sustainability.  Piracy has been a silent threat looming over the entertainment industry for decades now. The sad part is that even in the era where digital content flows effortlessly and there are several measures to tackle piracy, this plague isn’t slowing down. Its menace extends far beyond the loss of reverence, disrupting the broader ecosystem of the entertainment industry and leaving a big question mark on where we stand on cybersecurity.What is piracy?Piracy is the unlawful duplication, distribution, or utilization of copyrighted content, which encompasses music, films, software, and various types of intellectual property. It is regarded as a type of theft since it violates the rights of the original creators and can result in considerable financial harm to them.Raghav Chadha Takes A Vote On His Moustache | Parineeti’s Reply Steals The ShowThe rise of piracy in the digital ageIn 2023, a report by EY and the Internet and Mobile Association of India (IAMAI) indicated that 51 percent of media consumers in India obtain content through pirated sources, with streaming services accounting for the largest share at 63 percent."The size of India's piracy economy was Rs 22,400 crore in 2023, ranking fourth against the segment-wise revenue generated by India's Media and Entertainment industry. Of this, Rs 13,700 crore was generated from pirated content from movie theatres, while Rs 8,700 crore was generated from OTT platforms' content. The potential GST losses of up to Rs 4,300 crore were estimated to have been incurred," quoted the report..Rohit Jain, Chairman of IAMAI's Digital Entertainment Committee, added, “The rapid growth of digital entertainment in India is undeniable, with filmed entertainment expected to reach Rs 14,600 crore by 2026. However, this potential is severely threatened by rampant piracy. It is imperative for all stakeholders -- government bodies, industry players, and consumers--to unite in combating this issue."Later in 2024, Raghav Chadha, an active member of AAP and actor Parineeti Chopra’s husband, raised his voice on the matter of piracy in Rajya Sabha. He shared the clip on his social media handle with the caption - “Piracy is a significant plague that is all pervasive in the film industry and now in OTT world as well.” Sharing some statistics, he added, “The film industry is facing a loss of Rs 20,000 crore annually because of piracy. Online piracy saw a 62% surge during the pandemic.”“We passed the Cinematographic (Amendment) Bill, a year back but it lacks a concrete mechanism against online piracy and focuses largely on anti-cam recording in multiplexes. As we go digital with more movies being streamed on platforms, I ask the Government what is being done to curb the issue of digital piracy on OTT and whether the government has any plans to bring a dedicated legislation for the same?” he concluded.Industry weighs inETimes got in touch with some actors and filmmakers and asked them to speak on the impact of piracy on the industry. They offered a closer look at the domino effect it caused. “It's like if one production spends, there are 200-300 people that are connected with it, and everyone earns from it. It’s not that they don’t get money if there is piracy, but it becomes difficult for the production houses to bear something like this next time,” said Munawar Faruqui in his exclusive conversation with us.He added that both the audience and the production houses will have to put some extra effort into reducing piracy and its ill effects, “So it is like everyone is at a loss if there is piracy, and you said it correctly that piracy is the sad reality, and that is why we want to make good content that travels, even if it's good or bad, piracy should not be done, and the audience should take the responsibility for this.” “If they want to see entertainment, then they have to make some effort. At the same time, I think production houses make sure that they are making more efforts,” he concluded. Echoing the same sentiment, director Farhan P. Zamma shared, “Shooting for the promotion only requires almost 10 people. Just imagine they all want to see for free, if you say to remove the ads too, and we will see the pirated version. So how are people going to get paid, and how are they gonna get salaries? Or there will be no motivation to make anything further because until there is revenue, they will not earn anything. So nobody will invest in that business. This is very harsh because no one will get jobs.”On the other hand, actress Krystle D'souza shared her point of view on the subject, shared how it not only impacts the business but also the image of a movie. “I honestly feel, there used to be a time when box office collection meant if your film was a hit or miss, and if you didn’t get the collection, then your film would be titled as a flop film,” said the actress. She continued, “That is sad because you know sometimes some good films didn't make it as hits only because of piracy, only because people didn't go to theaters to watch it, but they all wanted to watch it at home and that's just sad for the entire crew, the entire team that put in so much of effort and energy to make a film.” A fight against piracy - One step at a timeThe bigger the movie, the more chances of piracy. Be it one of South’s biggest blockbusters, like ‘Pushpa 2’, or a controversial political biopic like ‘Emergency,’ in recent times, it has been observed that either the movie gets leaked online before the release, or a pirated version of it reaches the web. Considering all this, Aamir Khan, who gave his 2025’s highly anticipated film ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’, employed all the right efforts to fight piracy. "We have appointed anti-piracy teams who remove pirated links from the internet. The pay-per-view model I'm introducing, where people can watch a film for Rs 100, may help reduce piracy. It also gives some hope to creative people. It will not bring any change to the theatre chain because the experience is completely different," he told IANS.ConclusionThe war against piracy extends beyond legal measures. It is more about awareness, accountability, and appreciation for creative works. Industry voices emphasize that each pirated download or stream undermines not only box office sales but also the livelihoods and morale of those involved in storytelling.In the current scenario, there is a dire need for stricter regulations, anti-piracy initiatives, and innovative viewing options, along with the audience's support. While the journey may be difficult, a collaborative effort from creators, lawmakers, and consumers can help mitigate the impact of piracy, allowing art to flourish, stories to motivate, and the industry to expand.End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? Planning to Study in the U.S.? Here’s everything student travellers need to know from visa guidelines to new changes
In 2025, the U.S. implemented significant policy shifts impacting international students. These changes include mandatory public social media profiles for visa applicants, stricter vetting processes, and potential alterations to authorized stay calculations. Applicants should maintain clean online records, apply early, and stay updated through official government websites to navigate these evolving regulations.
Planning to Study in the U.S.? Here’s everything student travellers need to know from visa guidelines to new changes | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshiptravelHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newshome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carenewsadventureshotelsthings to dodestinationsNewslifestyletravelthings-to-doPlanning to Study in the U.S.? Here’s everything student travellers need to know from visa guidelines to new changesTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesPlanning to Study in the U.S.? Here’s everything student travellers need to know from visa guidelines to new changesetimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 16:42 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIn 2025, the U.S. implemented significant policy shifts impacting international students. These changes include mandatory public social media profiles for visa applicants, stricter vetting processes, and potential alterations to authorized stay calculations. Applicants should maintain clean online records, apply early, and stay updated through official government websites to navigate these evolving regulations.  U.S.is home to some reputed universities in the world and has been attracting global students for a long time now. However, in 2025 there have been some major policy shifts that have impacted the education industry as a whole. The U.S. policy makers have made a lot of changes. From making social media accounts public and pausing and resuming visa interviews to offering fixed-term eligibility under proposal, and increasing visa fees, the changes are endless and confusing too.So let’s try to understand the new changes:Make Social Media Public Amid several ongoing changes, the U.S. asked students wanting to study in American universities to make their social media profiles public because public persona matters. The new change was implemented from June 18, 2025. So now, applicants for F (academic), M (vocational), and J (exchange) visas should submit their social media accounts and set their accounts on public mode. The officers will check and scrutinise posts and other shared content of the applicants. This year, the federal government updated visa vetting and processing policies. Let’s have a look at why it matters and how is it going to impact students:The new changesThe Department of State in 2025 announced the plans of expanding visa screening. It very clearly mentioned the applicants’ online presence matter to the ‘getting whole visa’ process calling it a part of consular vetting. The Department called it an “expanded screening and vetting” process. The Department of State also updated its interview-waiver guidance. It changed to which applicants may be eligible for an in-person interview waiver. The Department also narrowed categories eligible for waiver in several cases. It means that more visa applicants should expect to attend an in-person interview unless they meet the specific waiver criteria. How will these changes impact students?Increased documentation and strict review: The new changes mean more documentations and a strict review process. The reviewers can request more personal information. They can also look beyond transcripts and bank statements and survey the applicant’s public online history and activity. More in-person questions during the interview: With the new interview-waiver rules, applicants should expect to attend consular interviews. Expect delays. Expect changes to authorized stay: If U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) finalises a fixed-term admission rule, the way students’ authorized stay is calculated would also change in future. It will affect program planning, transfers, and some employment authorizations tied to enrollment length. This is a significant move as it can change the “duration of status” system—where F visas remain valid as long as students maintain course enrollment.What current applicants/students must keep in mindKeep checking official sites only: The potential applicants must keep themselves updated with current changes on the official websites of the State Department, DHS/ICE (SEVP), and USCIS. These pages are for authoritative updates rather than unofficial commentary. Official pages have guidance, timelines, and eligibility rules as well. Do not trust any other website. Keep your record clean: Now that it is mandatory to keep your social media profile open, it is necessary for applicants to keep their record clean and monitor their online presence. Also remember that officials will only believe public information and official records.Apply early and book interviews: It is important to maintain the timeline. Apply early and book interviews as there are higher chances of required in-person interviews. Schedule embassy or consulate appointments the moment you get your Form I-20 or DS-2019. Allow buffer time: Keep extra or buffer time for program completion and other administrative steps. Keep copies of all documents and paperwork. Now that U.S. agencies are more concerned about vetting and tightening the conditions, expect delays and keep extra time and other options ready. These changes are official and mentioned on DHS/SEVP, and USCIS guidance. Keep in touch with your universities who can offer better explanations and guidance. (Official sources used here include: U.S. Department of State, Department of Homeland Security, ICE SEVP (SEVIS and program guidance), and USCIS (student classifications and employment rules).End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous10 quotes on marriages by Swami Premanand Ji MaharajLifestyleSharvari Wagh brings charm to every pink detailEntertainment10 animals that can survive intense radiationLifestyleHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeLifestyleDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have lookstv9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskLifestyleSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceEntertainmentCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? 5 style lessons to learn from cricketer Shubman Gill
From airport runs to ad campaigns, his wardrobe choices tell us one thing, Shubman knows the game when it comes to style just as much as he does cricket. Here are five fashion lessons to take straight from the captain’s playbook.
Shubman Gill: 5 style lessons to learn from Indian test cricket captain Shubman Gill Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipstyleHealth+visual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Careceleb stylestyle guidebuzzdesignersshowstimes luxuryvideosdesigner directoryNewslifestylefashionstyle-guide5 style lessons to learn from Indian test cricket captain Shubman GillTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest Countries5 style lessons to learn from Indian test cricket captain Shubman GillETimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/7One of the most stylish Indian cricketersShubman Gill might be making headlines for his explosive cover drives and steely temperament on the pitch, but off it, he’s quickly becoming one of India’s most photographed and most stylish, young sports stars. If Virat Kohli was the poster boy for sporty-meets-slick dressing in the last decade, Gill is the Gen-Z evolution: a blend of quiet luxury, streetwear confidence, and just the right amount of boyish charm.From airport runs to ad campaigns, his wardrobe choices tell us one thing, Shubman knows the game when it comes to style just as much as he does cricket. Here are five fashion lessons to take straight from the captain’s playbook.by TOI Lifestyle Desk 2/7Master the imnimalist athleisureAthleisure might feel like old news, but Gill’s approach keeps it fresh. He gravitates towards clean joggers, crisp crew-neck tees, fitted track jackets, and statement sneakers but with a muted palette. No screaming neons, no over-the-top graphics - just carefully chosen, well-fitted pieces. Think Rahul Khanna’s subtle elegance meets KL Rahul’s sporty edge.The takeaway: Your gym wear can double as your casualwear if you keep it neutral, fitted, and polished.3/7Invest in statement jacketsWhether it’s a bomber in deep forest green, a varsity jacket with bold lettering, or a tailored overcoat for winter tours abroad, Shubman treats jackets like sartorial punctuation marks. They finish his outfit with personality, much like Ranbir Kapoor’s off-duty looks or even David Beckham’s classic layering game.The takeaway: A good jacket doesn’t just keep you warm, it can carry an entire look.4/7Keep denim simple but sharpGill avoids the trap of over-distressed or overly baggy jeans. His go-to? Mid- to dark-wash denims with a straight or slim fit, paired with either a tucked-in shirt for a slightly retro vibe or a hoodie for casual comfort. The fit is never sloppy, more Shahid Kapoor’s tailored casuals than anything grungy.The takeaway: A well-fitted pair of jeans can last you seasons, both in durability and relevance.5/7Embrace monochrome momentsFrom head-to-toe black at the airport to all-white for summer outings, Shubman understands the power of a single-colour statement. It’s sleek, elongating, and always photogenic. In fact, one could argue it’s his version of a “uniform,” much like how Anand Ahuja built his signature sneaker-with-suit look.The takeaway: Don’t fear monochrome, it’s not boring if you mix textures and tones.6/7​Accessorise with restraintWhile some sports stars pile on chains, caps, and oversized shades, Gill opts for a more balanced approach. A single luxury watch, a subtle cap, or a pair of aviators, never all at once. His accessories are functional yet aspirational, much like the way Hrithik Roshan styles his off-duty looks.The takeaway: Let accessories enhance, not overwhelm, your outfit.7/7​Bonus lesson - grooming mattersIt’s impossible to talk about Shubman Gill’s style without mentioning his grooming. The always-on-point fade, the occasional stubble, and skin that somehow always looks camera-ready, it’s the cricketing equivalent of a red-carpet prep. Like David Warner said about cricket, “Preparation is everything,” and in Gill’s case, that includes his hair and skin game.Shubman Gill is proof that you don’t have to be in Bollywood to have a blockbuster wardrobe. His style is approachable yet aspirational, a mix of pieces you can find on the high street and the occasional big-ticket splurge. He isn’t trying too hard, but he’s paying attention and in fashion, much like cricket, that’s how you win the match.Whether you are a cricket fan or just looking for some wardrobe cues, consider Gill your new style captain. And remember: sometimes the most stylish move is knowing when to play it safe and when to take a risk, on the field and in your closet.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSharvari Wagh brings charm to every pink detailindia10 animals that can survive intense radiationindia10 Indian states with maximum number of National ParkstravelHow to make natural hair colour using tea and coffeeindiaDivyanka Tripathi’s top 10 stylish must-have looksindia​How to make dhaba-style Egg Curry at home​Food9 heart-healthy foods that cut attack and stroke riskindiaSaniya Iyappan steals the spotlight with her graceindiaCarrie Coon’s secret weapon on TV? What is ‘Arbi’ called in english? Know how it supports your heart, gut, and overall health
Arbi, or taro root, a versatile vegetable enjoyed worldwide, offers a creamy texture and nutty flavor. Beyond its taste, arbi is packed with fiber, potassium, and antioxidants, promoting digestive and heart health while boosting immunity. Enjoy it boiled, roasted, or in curries for sustained energy and strong bones. Remember to cook it well to eliminate calcium oxalate crystals.
What is ‘Arbi’ called in english? Know how it supports your heart, gut, and overall health | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipfood newsHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipestravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylefood-newsWhat is ‘Arbi’ called in english? Know how it supports your heart, gut, and overall healthTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesWhat is ‘Arbi’ called in english? Know how it supports your heart, gut, and overall healthTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:09 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArbi, or taro root, a versatile vegetable enjoyed worldwide, offers a creamy texture and nutty flavor. Beyond its taste, arbi is packed with fiber, potassium, and antioxidants, promoting digestive and heart health while boosting immunity. Enjoy it boiled, roasted, or in curries for sustained energy and strong bones. Remember to cook it well to eliminate calcium oxalate crystals.  If you’ve ever come across the word arbi and wondered what it means, you’re not alone. Arbi, known in English as taro root, is a starchy, underground vegetable enjoyed across Asia, Africa, and the Caribbean. Though it looks like a small, brown, fuzzy potato on the outside, it holds a creamy texture and nutty flavour inside that makes it incredibly versatile in the kitchen. Beyond taste, arbi offers numerous health benefits, making it a smart addition to your diet. Whether boiled, roasted, or added to curries, this humble root has far more to offer than meets the eye.What is arbi (Taro root)Arbi or taro root is a starchy tuber that grows underground and has been enjoyed by cultures worldwide for centuries. Its pale, creamy flesh and nutty flavour make it a versatile ingredient that can be boiled, fried, mashed, or added to stews. But what makes arbi special isn’t just the taste, it’s the range of health benefits packed inside this root.Why you should add arbi to your plate: Health benefits that matter1. Aids digestive health: One of the main benefits of arbi is its high fibre content, which helps maintain healthy digestion. Fibre adds bulk to stools, promoting regular bowel movements and preventing constipation. A well-functioning digestive system also supports better nutrient absorption and reduces the risk of digestive disorders.2. Supports heart health: Arbi is a good source of potassium, a mineral essential for maintaining healthy blood pressure levels. Potassium helps balance the effects of sodium and eases tension in blood vessel walls, reducing the risk of hypertension and heart disease. Eating potassium-rich foods like arbi can be an effective part of heart-friendly dietary habits.3. Boost your immunity: Thanks to antioxidants found in arbi, your body gets an extra shield against harmful free radicals. This support means your immune system can work more effectively to keep common illnesses at bay.4. Steady energy for your busy day: Unlike sugary snacks that give you a quick rush and then a crash, arbi provides slow-releasing energy. This means you’ll feel energised for longer, perfect for powering through work, study, or workouts.5. Strong bones and muscles: Arbi also contains minerals like magnesium and calcium that are essential for bone strength and muscle function. Eating arbi regularly may support your mobility and overall body strength as you age.6. Fighting inflammation naturally: Chronic inflammation is linked to many health problems, but nature offers help in arbi. Some compounds in taro root have anti-inflammatory properties, which might help reduce discomfort and protect your body long-term.How to enjoy arbiThe great thing about arbi is that it’s incredibly versatile. Here are some ways you can enjoy it:Boiled or steamed: Simply cook until tender and season with salt and herbs for a comforting side dish.Taro chips: Slice thinly and fry or bake for a crunchy snack that rivals regular potato chips.Curries and stews: Add chunks of arbi to your favourite curries or soups to soak up all the spices and flavours.Mashed arbi: Like mashed potatoes, but with a nuttier taste- try mixing with butter and garlic for a creamy delight.Soups: Add it to broths for a hearty texture and subtle sweetness.Important tips: What you need to know before eating arbiRaw arbi contains tiny needle-like crystals called calcium oxalate, which can irritate your mouth or throat. That’s why always cook it well before eating. Boiling, steaming, or frying will break down these crystals and make it safe and delicious.If you have a history of kidney stones, it’s best to eat arbi in moderation because of its oxalate content.Also read | Is eating avocados daily safe? Kidney cleansing and detoxing myths: What you should know
Kidney detoxes are popular, but the kidneys naturally filter blood and remove waste. Detox teas and juices lack scientific support and may harm kidney function. While hydration is important, excessive water intake can strain kidneys. A balanced diet, regular exercise, and managing underlying conditions are proven ways to support kidney health.
Kidney cleansing and detoxing myths: What you should know | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsKidney cleansing and detoxing myths: What you should knowTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney cleansing and detoxing myths: What you should knowTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKidney detoxes are popular, but the kidneys naturally filter blood and remove waste. Detox teas and juices lack scientific support and may harm kidney function. While hydration is important, excessive water intake can strain kidneys. A balanced diet, regular exercise, and managing underlying conditions are proven ways to support kidney health.  Kidney detoxes and cleansing routines have become increasingly popular, often promoted as quick solutions to improve kidney health, remove toxins, or boost overall wellness. From herbal teas to juice fasts, many of these methods promise results that sound too good to be true. The truth is that your kidneys are already excellent at detoxifying your body without any special interventions. Misunderstanding how the kidneys work can lead to unnecessary or even harmful health practices. Falling for these myths may not only waste your time and money but also put your kidney health at risk.What kidney detox myths get wrong about your healthMyth 1: Your kidneys need regular cleansingOne of the most widespread health myths is the idea that your kidneys need to be cleansed or flushed with specific drinks or diets. In reality, healthy kidneys continuously filter your blood, remove waste products, and balance your body's fluids and electrolytes. They do this naturally and efficiently. Unless your kidneys are damaged or diseased, they do not require any external cleansing. The best way to support them is through good nutrition, proper hydration, and regular health checks.Myth 2: Detox teas and juices can repair or improve kidney functionDetox teas, juices, and supplements often claim to remove toxins or enhance kidney function, but these claims are not supported by scientific evidence. Many of these products are unregulated and may contain high levels of certain herbs or diuretics that can stress the kidneys rather than help them. In some cases, they may lead to dehydration or mineral imbalances. If you have any kidney condition, these types of detoxes may do more harm than good.Myth 3: Drinking more water always helps cleanse the kidneysWhile staying hydrated is important for kidney function, more water is not always better. Drinking too much water can dilute essential salts in the body and place strain on the kidneys. People with healthy kidneys should aim to drink according to their body's needs, which can vary based on activity level, environment, and individual health conditions. For most people, drinking when thirsty and monitoring the colour of urine is enough to stay well hydrated.Myth 4: A kidney cleanse helps remove kidney stonesSome believe that consuming large amounts of citrus juice or herbal drinks can flush out kidney stones or prevent their formation. While drinking water and maintaining a balanced diet can help prevent stones in some cases, a true kidney cleanse will not dissolve or remove existing stones. Treatment for kidney stones depends on their size and type and often requires medical supervision. Relying on home remedies could delay proper care and increase the risk of complications.What really supports your kidney healthThe kidneys thrive when you take care of your overall health. The following lifestyle choices are proven to support kidney function:Eat a balanced diet that is low in sodium and processed foodsLimit your intake of red meat and animal fatsStay physically active and maintain a healthy weightAvoid smoking and limit alcohol consumptionManage underlying conditions such as high blood pressure and diabetesStay hydrated without overdoing itAvoid overuse of painkillers and unnecessary supplementsThese habits can help protect your kidneys from damage and reduce your risk of developing chronic kidney disease.Also read | Urine colour and kidney problems: Signs you shouldn’t ignoreAbout the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Is eating avocados daily safe? The possible allergies and digestive side effects you must know
While avocados are celebrated for their health benefits, they can trigger allergic reactions, especially in those with latex allergies. Overconsumption may lead to digestive issues and weight gain due to their high calorie and fiber content. Avocados can also interfere with blood-thinning medications because of their vitamin K levels and potentially trigger migraines in susceptible individuals.
Is eating avocados daily safe? The possible allergies and digestive side effects you must know | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipfood newsHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipestravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylefood-newsIs eating avocados daily safe? The possible allergies and digestive side effects you must knowTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesIs eating avocados daily safe? The possible allergies and digestive side effects you must knowTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 11, 2025, 16:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWhile avocados are celebrated for their health benefits, they can trigger allergic reactions, especially in those with latex allergies. Overconsumption may lead to digestive issues and weight gain due to their high calorie and fiber content. Avocados can also interfere with blood-thinning medications because of their vitamin K levels and potentially trigger migraines in susceptible individuals.  Avocados are a popular superfood known for their creamy texture and rich nutrient profile, including healthy fats, fibre, and vitamins. However, despite their benefits, avocados can cause side effects in some people. Allergic reactions, particularly among those with latex allergies, are common. Overconsumption may lead to digestive issues like bloating and gas, especially in individuals with sensitive stomachs or IBS. Due to their high calorie content, excessive intake can contribute to weight gain. Avocados also contain vitamin K, which may interfere with blood-thinning medications. Additionally, they can trigger migraines in susceptible individuals. Eating avocados in moderation and consulting a healthcare provider is advisable.Risks and side effects of eating avocados daily1. Allergic reactionsSome individuals may experience allergic reactions after consuming avocados. Symptoms can range from mild itching and skin rashes to more severe reactions like breathing difficulties or anaphylaxis. People with latex allergies are at a higher risk of developing an avocado allergy due to cross-reactivity .From Avocado to Zinc: Key nutrients for healthy skin and how to get them2. Digestive issuesAvocados are high in fibre, which is beneficial for gut health. However, consuming them in excess may cause bloating, gas, or stomach cramps. Individuals with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) need to exercise extra caution .3. High-calorie contentWhile avocados contain healthy fats, they are also calorie-dense. Overeating can lead to weight gain, particularly for individuals managing their calorie intake. If you are mindful of your weight, it's best to enjoy avocados in moderation .4. Interaction with medicationsAvocados contain vitamin K, which plays a crucial role in blood clotting. For individuals on blood-thinning medications like warfarin, consuming avocados in large amounts can interfere with the medication's effectiveness .5. Migraine triggersAvocados are a source of the amino acid tyrosine, which naturally breaks down into tyramine in the body. High levels of tyramine can trigger headaches and elevate blood pressure, potentially leading to migraines .6. Latex-fruit syndromeIndividuals with latex allergies may also be sensitive to avocados. This condition, known as latex-fruit syndrome, can cause symptoms ranging from mild itching to more severe reactions .7. Mouth irritationSome people may experience mild oral symptoms, such as itching or tingling in the mouth, when consuming avocados. This can be associated with cross-reactivity with pollen allergens .8. Foodborne illness riskLike any other fresh produce, avocados can sometimes carry harmful bacteria, such as Salmonella or E. coli. Contamination can occur if avocados are handled improperly, left at unsafe temperatures, or not washed thoroughly before consumption .Frequently Asked QuestionsQ1: Can avocados cause allergic reactions?Yes, some individuals may experience allergic reactions to avocados, ranging from mild itching to severe anaphylaxis, particularly those with latex allergies.Q2: Are avocados high in calories?Yes, avocados are calorie-dense due to their healthy fat content. Overconsumption can lead to weight gain if not balanced with other dietary components.Q3: Can avocados interact with medications?Avocados contain vitamin K, which can interfere with blood-thinning medications like warfarin. It's essential to monitor your intake if you're on such medications.Q4: Are avocados safe for people with IBS?Individuals with IBS should consume avocados in moderation, as their high fibre content can cause digestive discomfort in some people.Q5: Can avocados cause foodborne illnesses?Improper handling and storage of avocados can lead to contamination with harmful bacteria, posing a risk of foodborne illnesses.Also read | Is multigrain, zero maida bread really better for your blood sugar levels? Can VitaminB12 deficiency cause nerve damage? Here’s what you need to know
Vitamin B12 is important for nerve health. Low levels can cause tingling and numbness. It may also lead to balance problems and memory loss. If not treated, nerve damage can become permanent. Vegans and older adults are at higher risk. Blood tests can check B12 levels. Treatment includes supplements or injections. Early action is key to prevent lasting harm.
Can VitaminB12 deficiency cause nerve damage? Here’s what you need to know | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsCan VitaminB12 deficiency cause nerve damage? Here’s what you need to knowTrendingKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesKidney DamageGuava Leaf TeaFreshwater Aquarium FishesBanana BreakfastKidney DiseaseColon CancerDiabetes ManagementVitamin B12 DeficiencyHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEurope Poorest CountriesCan VitaminB12 deficiency cause nerve damage? Here’s what you need to knowTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 11, 2025, 15:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeVitamin B12 is important for nerve health. Low levels can cause tingling and numbness. It may also lead to balance problems and memory loss. If not treated, nerve damage can become permanent. Vegans and older adults are at higher risk. Blood tests can check B12 levels. Treatment includes supplements or injections. Early action is key to prevent lasting harm.  Vitamin B12 plays a vital role in maintaining the health of the nervous system, including the brain, nerves, and spinal cord. A deficiency in this essential nutrient can lead to a range of neurological symptoms, such as tingling, numbness, poor coordination, memory loss, and mood changes. If left untreated, prolonged vitamin B12 deficiency may result in irreversible nerve damage. This is particularly concerning as neurological symptoms can appear before signs of anaemia. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial to prevent long-term complications. Regular monitoring and a balanced diet or supplementation can help maintain healthy B12 levels and protect nerve health.What is Vitamin B12: Signs of deficiency that affects nerve healthVitamin B12 (also known as cobalamin) helps produce red blood cells, supports DNA synthesis, and plays a key role in maintaining healthy nerve cells. It’s naturally found in animal-based foods such as meat, fish, eggs, and dairy. People following plant-based diets, or those with medical conditions affecting absorption, are most at risk of developing a deficiency.Vitamin B12 rich foods for vegetarian dietVitamin B12 deficiency can lead to neurological symptoms even before blood levels drop enough to cause anaemia. Common nerve-related signs include:Tingling or numbness in the hands, feet, or legsBalance issues or frequent fallsWeakness in musclesMemory loss or difficulty concentratingMood changes, including depression or irritabilityBurning sensations in extremitiesCoordination problems while walkingThese symptoms may begin subtly but can worsen over time, especially if not addressed early.How low Vitamin B12 causes nerve damageVitamin B12 is vital for the production of myelin – the protective coating around nerves. When B12 is deficient, myelin begins to break down, exposing nerves to damage. This can disrupt communication between the brain and the rest of the body, resulting in symptoms like numbness, weakness, and cognitive issues.In severe cases, B12 deficiency can lead to subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord, a serious neurological condition that may cause:Stiffness in the limbsPoor coordinationDifficulty walkingLoss of vibration or position senseIf untreated, some of this nerve damage may become permanent.Who is at risk of Vitamin B12 deficiencyVitamin B12 deficiency can affect anyone, but some groups are more vulnerable:Older adults (reduced absorption with age)Vegans and vegetarians (plant foods lack natural B12)People with gastrointestinal conditions, such as Crohn’s disease or coeliac diseaseThose taking certain medications, like metformin or proton pump inhibitorsPatients who have had bariatric or stomach surgeryTreatment options for VitaminB12 deficiency typically includes:Vitamin B12 injections for severe deficiency or poor absorptionOral B12 supplements for mild casesDietary changes to include B12-rich or fortified foodsImprovements may take weeks or months depending on how long the deficiency has been present.When to see a doctorIf you experience symptoms like persistent numbness, tingling, balance issues, or mental fog, speak to your GP. A simple blood test can check your B12 levels. Your doctor may also test homocysteine or methylmalonic acid (MMA) if results are borderline.Early diagnosis and treatment are essential to prevent long-term nerve damage.Frequently Asked QuestionsQ1. Can nerve damage from low B12 be reversed?Yes, but only if caught early. Many symptoms, including fatigue, tingling, and memory issues, often improve with treatment. However, long-term deficiency can lead to irreversible nerve damage, especially in older adults.Q2. Is nerve damage from low vitamin B12 permanent?Nerve damage may be reversible if treated early, but long-term deficiency can cause permanent damage. Early diagnosis and treatment are essential.Also read | Why kidney infections spike during the monsoon season and how to stay safeAbout the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers.
